        (b) Kitagawa, S.; Kitaura, R.; Noro, S. Angew. Chem., Int. Ed. 2004, 43, 2334
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        1b
        Functional porous coordination polymers
        Kitagawa, Susumu; Kitaura, Ryo; Noro, Shin-ichiro
        Angewandte Chemie, International Edition (2004), 43 (18), 2334-2375CODEN: ACIEF5; ISSN:1433-7851. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
        A review. Discussion concs. on three aspects of coordination polymers: (1) the use of crystal engineering to construct porous frameworks from connectors and linkers (nano-space engineering), (2) characterizing and cataloging the porous properties by functions for storage, exchange, sepn., etc., and (3) the next generation of porous functions based on dynamic crystal transformations caused by guest mols. or phys. stimuli. The authors' aim is to present the state of the art chem. and physics of and in the micropores of porous coordination polymers.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2cXktFShtLk%253D&md5=9df52e99bad3cc0db67f65551a8c154f
        (c) Perry, J. J., IV; Perman, J. A.; Zaworotko, M. J. Chem. Soc. Rev. 2009, 38, 1400
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        1c
        Design and synthesis of metal-organic frameworks using metal-organic polyhedra as supermolecular building blocks
        Perry, John J., IV; Perman, Jason A.; Zaworotko, Michael J.
        Chemical Society Reviews (2009), 38 (5), 1400-1417CODEN: CSRVBR; ISSN:0306-0012. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        This crit. review highlights supermol. building blocks (SBBs) in the context of their impact upon the design, synthesis, and structure of metal-org. materials (MOMs). MOMs, also known as coordination polymers, hybrid inorg.-org. materials, and metal-org. frameworks, represent an emerging class of materials that have attracted the imagination of solid-state chemists because MOMs combine unprecedented levels of porosity with a range of other functional properties that occur through the metal moiety and/or the org. ligand. First generation MOMs exploited the geometry of metal ions or secondary building units (SBUs), small metal clusters that mimic polygons, for the generation of MOMs. In this crit. review we examine the recent (<5 years) adoption of much larger scale metal-org. polyhedra (MOPs) as SBBs for the construction of MOMs by highlighting how the large size and high symmetry of such SBBs can afford improved control over the topol. of the resulting MOM and a new level of scale to the resulting framework (204 refs.).
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1MXkvValsr4%253D&md5=296a7ae534acdc37203ce097b2013d18
        (d) Cook, T. R.; Zheng, Y. R.; Stang, P. J. Chem. Rev. 2013, 113, 734
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        1d
        Metal-Organic Frameworks and Self-Assembled Supramolecular Coordination Complexes: Comparing and Contrasting the Design, Synthesis, and Functionality of Metal-Organic Materials
        Cook, Timothy R.; Zheng, Yao-Rong; Stang, Peter J.
        Chemical Reviews (Washington, DC, United States) (2013), 113 (1), 734-777CODEN: CHREAY; ISSN:0009-2665. (American Chemical Society)
        A review. In recent decades, two new branches of coordination chem. have emerged, metal-org. frameworks (MOFs) and supramol. coordination complexes (SCCs). The former are comprised of infinite networks of metal centers or inorg. clusters bridged by simple org. linkers through metal-ligand coordination bonds. The latter encompass discrete systems in which carefully selected metal centers undergo self-assembly with ligands contg. multiple binding sites oriented with specific angularity to generate a finite supramol. complex. On the most basic level, both SCCs and MOFs share the design of metal nodes linked by org. ligands and such constructs can be broadly defined as metal-org. materials (MOMs). This review is intended to illustrate the commonalities in design, building blocks, and applications while also pointing out how and why the chem. of MOFs and SCCs is unique.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC38Xhs1WgsbjO&md5=7a17a24cd40c76e84ea036c992dd8953
        (e) Sun, H. L.; Wang, Z. M.; Gao, S. Coord. Chem. Rev. 2010, 254, 1081
        [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
        1e
        Strategies towards single-chain magnets
        Sun, Hao-Ling; Wang, Zhe-Ming; Gao, Song
        Coordination Chemistry Reviews (2010), 254 (9-10), 1081-1100CODEN: CCHRAM; ISSN:0010-8545. (Elsevier B.V.)
        A review. Single-chain magnets (SCM) are a novel class of mol. magnetic materials exhibiting slow magnetic relaxation, which arises from large uniaxial type magnetic anisotropy, strong intrachain and very weak or negligible interchain magnetic interactions. Although more than 20 examples of SCM have been reported, the controlled synthesis of SCM is still a challenge. Here we review the three strategies for the construction of SCM, highlight typical examples, discuss the role of intrachain and interchain interactions on the overall magnetic behavior of SCM as well as how to control or tune these interactions. For each strategy we present the advantages/shortcoming and then point out the main directions that remain to be developed in the field.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3cXivVOqu7g%253D&md5=4db15a1fd9a751f6506a32eb1a493062
        (f) Zhang, W.; Xiong, R. G. Chem. Rev. 2012, 112, 1163
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        1f
        Ferroelectric Metal-Organic Frameworks
        Zhang, Wen; Xiong, Ren-Gen
        Chemical Reviews (Washington, DC, United States) (2012), 112 (2), 1163-1195CODEN: CHREAY; ISSN:0009-2665. (American Chemical Society)
        A review.

        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3MXht1Wks7bL&md5=4b6508e05976c27d409579160aa4b14e
        (g) Férey, G. Chem. Soc. Rev. 2008, 37, 191
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        1g
        Hybrid porous solids: past, present, future
        Ferey, Gerard
        Chemical Society Reviews (2008), 37 (1), 191-214CODEN: CSRVBR; ISSN:0306-0012. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        A review. This crit. review will be of interest to the experts in porous solids (including catalysis), but also solid state chemists and physicists. It presents the state-of-the-art on hybrid porous solids, their advantages, their new routes of synthesis, the structural concepts useful for their 'design', aiming at reaching very large pores. Their dynamic properties and the possibility of predicting their structure are described. The large tunability of the pore size leads to unprecedented properties and applications. They concern adsorption of species, storage and delivery and the phys. properties of the dense phases. (323 refs.).
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1cXmtVWgsg%253D%253D&md5=89265036ce82503c95ce56685a9ceceb
      2. 2
        (a) Farha, O. K.; Hupp, J. T. Acc. Chem. Res. 2010, 43, 1166
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        2a
        Rational Design, Synthesis, Purification, and Activation of Metal-Organic Framework Materials
        Farha, Omar K.; Hupp, Joseph T.
        Accounts of Chemical Research (2010), 43 (8), 1166-1175CODEN: ACHRE4; ISSN:0001-4842. (American Chemical Society)
        A review of recent advances in the synthetic design, purifn., and activation of metal-org. framework materials. The rational design of a series of org. struts to limit framework catenation and thereby produce large pores is described. In addn., the rapid sepn. of desired metal-org. frameworks from cryst. and amorphous contaminants cogenerated during synthesis based on their different densities is demonstrated. Finally, the mild and efficient activation of initially solvent-filled pores with supercrit. carbon dioxide, yielding usable channels and high internal surface areas is discussed. Now constituting thousands of distinct examples, metal-org. frameworks are an intriguing class of hybrid materials that exist as infinite cryst. lattices with inorg. vertices and mol.-scale org. connectors. Useful properties such as large internal surface areas, ultralow densities, and the availability of uniformly structured cavities and portals of mol. dimensions characterize functional metal-org. frameworks. Researchers have effectively exploited these unusual properties in applications such as hydrogen and methane storage, chem. sepns., and selective chem. catalysis. One of the most attractive features of metal-org. frameworks is the simplicity of their synthesis. Typically they are obtained via one-pot solvothermal prepns. However, metal-org. framework materials, esp. more complex ones, can be difficult to obtain in pure form and with the optimal degree of catenation, the interpenetration or interweaving of identical independent networks. Once these two issues are satisfied, the removal of the guest mols. (solvent from synthesis) without damaging the structural integrity of the material is often an addnl. challenge. We expect that the advances in the synthesis, sepn., and activation of metal-org. frameworks could lead to metal-org. frameworks with new structures and functions, better and faster sepn. and purifn. of these materials, and processing methods that avoid pore blockage and pore collapse.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3cXosVyjtbY%253D&md5=be96ac34a74a551550ba08c66dcbd4b6
        (b) Ye, N.; Tu, C.; Long, X.; Hong, M. Cryst. Growth Des. 2010, 10, 4672
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        2b
        Recent Advances in Crystal Growth in China: Laser, Nonlinear Optical, and Ferroelectric Crystals
        Ye, Ning; Tu, Chaoyang; Long, Xifa; Hong, Maochun
        Crystal Growth & Design (2010), 10 (11), 4672-4681CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        A review. Crystal growth in China has a long history and is developing rapidly at the present time. In the past decade, significant efforts were directed toward the research of structure-property relations and high quality crystal growth, which has brought to fruition many fields covering nonlinear optical, laser, ferro-/piezoelec., and wide band gap semiconductor crystals. In this contribution, selected research work accomplished by Chinese scientists in crystal engineering and growth is reviewed.

        A review. The progress is discussed in the mol. design, prepn. and properties of metal azolate frameworks including complexes with imidazolates, pyrazolates, 1,2,4-triazolates, 1,2,3-triazolates and tetrazolates.

        2d
        Novel (3,4,6)-Connected Metal-Organic Framework with High Stability and Gas-Uptake Capability
        Hou, Chao; Liu, Qing; Fan, Jian; Zhao, Yue; Wang, Peng; Sun, Wei-Yin
        Inorganic Chemistry (2012), 51 (15), 8402-8408CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        A microporous and noninterpenetrated metal-org. framework [Cu3(L)2(DABCO)(H2O)]·15H2O·9DMF (1) was synthesized using two different ligands, [1,1':3',1''-terphenyl]-4,4'',5'-tricarboxylic acid (H3L) and 1,4-diazabicyclo[2.2.2]octane (DABCO). As revealed by variable-temp. powder x-ray diffraction (VT-PXRD) measurements, N,N'-ditopic DABCO plays an important role for stabilization of the Cu-L framework. The three-dimensional framework of 1 exhibits high stability and excellent adsorption capacity for H2 (54.3 mg g-1 at 77 K and 20 bar), CO2 (871 mg g-1 at 298 K and 20 bar), CH4 (116.7 mg g-1, 99 cm3 (STP) cm-3 at 298 K and 20 bar), and n-pentane (686 mg g-1 at 298 K and 1 bar). The excellent selectivity toward CO2 over N2 at ambient temp. (273 and 298 K) and 1 bar makes complex 1 possess practical application in gas sepn. and purifn.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC38XhtVCmtL%252FP&md5=57d2f9ad8b1e02e27aca15f2e9e8667d
        (e) Almeida Paz, F. A.; Klinowski, J.; Vilela, S. M. F.; Tome, J. P. C.; Cavaleiro, J. A. S.; Rocha, J. Chem. Soc. Rev. 2012, 41, 1088
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        2e
        Ligand design for functional metal-organic frameworks
        Almeida Paz, Filipe A.; Klinowski, Jacek; Vilela, Sergio M. F.; Tome, Joao P. C.; Cavaleiro, Jose A. S.; Rocha, Joao
        Chemical Society Reviews (2012), 41 (3), 1088-1110CODEN: CSRVBR; ISSN:0306-0012. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        A review. Metal-org. frameworks (MOFs), also known as coordination polymers, are formed by the self-assembly of metallic centers and bridging org. linkers. In this crit. review, the authors review the key advances in the field and discuss the relation between the nature and structure of specifically designed org. linkers and the properties of the products. Practical examples demonstrate that the phys. and chem. properties of the linkers play a decisive role in the properties of novel functional MOFs. The authors focus on target materials suitable for the storage of hydrogen and methane, sequestration of CO2, gas sepn., heterogeneous catalysis and as magnetic and photoluminescent materials capable of both metal- and ligand-centered emission, ion exchangers and mol. sieves. The advantages of highly active discrete complexes as metal-bearing ligands in the construction of MOFs are also briefly reviewed.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC38Xns1ygtg%253D%253D&md5=79722912ebb1868780aa775272c8f6e0
        (f) Wu, P.; He, C.; Wang, J.; Peng, X.; Li, X.; An, Y.; Duan, C. J. Am. Chem. Soc. 2012, 134, 14991
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        2f
        Photoactive chiral metal-organic frameworks for light-driven asymmetric α-alkylation of aldehydes
        Wu, Pengyan; He, Cheng; Wang, Jian; Peng, Xiaojun; Li, Xuezhao; An, Yonglin; Duan, Chunying
        Journal of the American Chemical Society (2012), 134 (36), 14991-14999CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
        Chiral metal-org. frameworks (MOFs) with porous and tunable nature show promise as heterogeneous asym. catalysts. Through incorporating the stereoselective organocatalyst l- or d-pyrrolidin-2-ylimidazole (PYI) and a triphenylamine photoredox group into a single framework, we have developed two enantiomeric MOFs, Zn-PYI1 and Zn-PYI2, to prompt the asym. α-alkylation of aliph. aldehydes in a heterogeneous manner. The strong reductive excited state of the triphenylamaine moiety within these MOFs initiated a photoinduced electron transfer, rendering an active intermediate for the α-alkylation. The chiral PYI moieties acted as cooperative organocatalytic active sites to drive the asym. catalysis with significant stereoselectivity. Control expts. using the lanthanide-based metal-org. frameworks Ho-TCA and MOF-150, assembled from 4,4',4''-nitrilotribenzoic acid, as catalysts suggested that both the photosensitizer triphenylamine moiety and the chiral organocatalyst d-/l-PYI moiety were necessary for the light-driven α-alkylation reactions. Further investigations demonstrated that the integration of both photocatalyst and asym. organocatalyst into a single MOF makes the enantioselection superior to that of simply mixing the corresponding MOFs with the chiral adduct. The easy availability, excellent stereoselectivity, great separability, and individual components fixed with their well-defined porous and repeating structures make the MOF a versatile platform for a new type of tandem catalyst and cooperative catalyst.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC38XhtFOru7%252FM&md5=680d6ad86145b5a91bf3921062a70e61
      3. 3
        (a) Du, M.; Li, C. P.; Liu, C. S.; Fang, S. M. Coord. Chem. Rev. 2013, 257, 1282
        [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
        3a
        Design and construction of coordination polymers with mixed-ligand synthetic strategy
        Du, Miao; Li, Cheng-Peng; Liu, Chun-Sen; Fang, Shao-Ming
        Coordination Chemistry Reviews (2013), 257 (7-8), 1282-1305CODEN: CCHRAM; ISSN:0010-8545. (Elsevier B.V.)
        A review. The rational construction of coordination polymers (CPs), normally existing as infinite cryst. lattices extended from inorg. vertexes and org. struts, essentially benefits from the development of crystal engineering strategies. In this review, the authors summarily comment on the key advances in the design of CPs using mixed-ligand synthetic strategy and discuss the relation between the specifically selected mixed org. ligands and the resulting CPs. Significantly, fine tuning on the structural features of org. ligands, such as spacers, positional isomers, and substituents, can lead to a delicate regulation of the diverse network structures of CPs. Addnl., such mixed-ligand coordination assemblies may also be heavily affected by metal ion, synthetic route, and some other external stimuli such as solvent and pH condition, etc. The advantages of mixed-ligand systems as promising approaches to construct CPs-based cryst. materials with interesting structures and useful properties will also be demonstrated.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3sXjt1aiurg%253D&md5=154cf829c9fb70520dede9e7a1539dd7

        [PubMed], Google Scholar
        There is no corresponding record for this reference.
        (c) Gai, Y. L.; Jiang, F. L.; Chen, L.; Bu, Y.; Wu, M. Y.; Zhou, K.; Pan, J.; Hong, M. C. Dalton Trans. 2013, 42, 9954
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        3c
        A series of novel zinc(II) entangled coordination polymers based on carboxyphenyl-terpyridine ligands
        Gai, Yan-Li; Jiang, Fei-Long; Chen, Lian; Bu, Yang; Wu, Ming-Yan; Zhou, Kang; Pan, Jie; Hong, Mao-Chun
        Dalton Transactions (2013), 42 (27), 9954-9965CODEN: DTARAF; ISSN:1477-9226. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        Hydrothermal synthesis has afforded five divalent Zn coordination polymers contg. 4-(4-carboxyphenyl)-2,2':6',2''-terpyridine (HL1) or its isomer 4-(4-carboxyphenyl)-2,2':4',4''-terpyridine (HL2), with or without the addn. of auxiliary ligands, 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylic acid (H3btc) and 1,4-benzenedicarboxylic acid (H2bdc). Their structures were characterized by single crystal x-ray analyses and further characterized by IR spectra, elemental analyses, powder X-ray diffraction, thermogravimetric analyses and photoluminescent spectra. Across this series, the π···π interactions have a dramatic impact on the self-assembly of these entanglement structures, in either case it can exert an important structure-directing role. The disposition of pyridine N atoms in ligands also plays a large role in structure direction in this system. The first complex is a 2-dimensional + 2-dimensional 3-dimensional inclined polycatenated coordination polymer based on the resulting array of 2-dimensional (6,3) layers constructed by 1-dimensional 2-dimensional π···π directed self-assembly. The second complex is assembled into a 3-dimensional framework by 1-dimensional + 1-dimensional 3-dimensional mutual interdigitation based on 1-dimensional 1-dimensional self-assembly driven by π···π stacking interactions. The third complex shows a 2-dimensional + 2-dimensional 3-dimensional interdigital network involving 2-dimensional + 2-dimensional 2-dimensional parallel interpenetrated and 2-dimensional + 2-dimensional 2-dimensional interdigital (4,4) layer motifs. The fourth complex displays a 2-dimensional + 2-dimensional 3-dimensional polythreaded framework based on a 2-dimensional (4,4) network comprised of alternating rings and rods. The last complex is a (3,4)-connected 3-dimensional framework with topol. (4.82.103)(4.82). In comparison with covalently connected entanglements, such π···π directing self-assembly of entanglements are far less explored, esp., polycatenane based on 1-dimensional chain motifs and polythread based on 2-dimensional layer motifs are rarely reported. Also, the luminescent properties of complexes at room temp. also were studied in detail herein.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3sXps1yltLk%253D&md5=ec9dbd84debdace111e12607856a3aa5
        (d) Li, H.-J.; Zhao, B.; Ding, R.; Jia, Y.-Y.; Hou, H.-W.; Fan, Y.-T. Cryst. Growth Des. 2012, 12, 4170
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        3d
        Structural Diversity for a Series of Novel Zn Metal-Organic Frameworks Based on Different Secondary Building Units
        Li, Huijun; Zhao, Bei; Ding, Ran; Jia, Yanyuan; Hou, Hongwei; Fan, Yaoting
        Crystal Growth & Design (2012), 12 (8), 4170-4179CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        The secondary building unit (SBU) was identified as a useful tool in the synthesis of metal-org. frameworks (MOFs). Herein, the authors synthesized six novel Zn complexes, namely, {[Zn3(tci)2(DMF)2]·2DMF·2CH3OH}n (1), {[Zn3(tci)2(DMSO)2(H2O)2]·2DMSO·3H2O}n (2), {[ZnNa(tci)(H2O)]·2H2O}n (3), {[Zn5(tci)2(OH)4(H2O)2]·2H2O}n (4), {[Zn3(tci)2(phen)2(H2O)2]·4H2O}n (5), and {[Zn3(tci)2(btb)2(H2O)2]·6H2O}n (6) by using different SBUs (tci = 1,3,5-tris(2-carboxyethyl)isocyanurate, phen = 1,10-phenanthroline, btb = 1,4-bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene). Complexes 1-4 were synthesized only by changing solvents, and complexes 5 and 6 were obtained by adding different auxiliary ligands on the same conditions. Structural analyses show that complexes 1 and 2 possess two-dimensional (2D) structures based on linear and triangular trinuclear Zn clusters. Complexes 3 and 4 exhibit 2-dimensional and three-dimensional (3D) frameworks built on rare infinite rod-shaped SBUs, while complex 5 belongs to a 3-dimensional framework with two kinds of left- and right-helical chains built from discrete dinuclear Zn clusters and mononuclear Zn atoms. Complex 6 exhibits high-connected 3-dimensional framework based on extended linear trinuclear Zn clusters.
        >> More from SciFinder ®

        4a
        Coordination polymer networks with O- and N-donors: what they are, why and how they are made
        Robin, Adeline Y.; Fromm, Katharina M.
        Coordination Chemistry Reviews (2006), 250 (15+16), 2127-2157CODEN: CCHRAM; ISSN:0010-8545. (Elsevier B.V.)
        A review. With this review on metal ion contg. coordination polymer networks we will highlight the current research in the field by giving a short overview on the concept of coordination polymers networks and how and why they are made. Several reviews on different aspects of coordination polymer compds. will be grouped and briefly presented in the introduction. Recent examples for different dimensionalities of the networks will be presented as well as representative compds. for specific applications. Polymorphism, supramol. isomerism, pseudo-polymorphism and solvates will be discussed. We will limit the review to the more recent results in the field and restrain the examples to the more common O-donor and mainly N-donor ligands. As our own interests lie in the field of group 11 elements, some of our focus will be within this field.
        >> More from SciFinder ®

        Coordination Assemblies from a Pd(II)-Cornered Square Complex
        Fujita, Makoto; Tominaga, Masahide; Hori, Akiko; Therrien, Bruno
        Accounts of Chemical Research (2005), 38 (4), 369-378CODEN: ACHRE4; ISSN:0001-4842. (American Chemical Society)
        A review. The [enPd(II)]2+ (en = ethylenediamine) unit has emerged as a versatile building block in mol. self-assembly. In particular, the 90° coordination angle of the metal was judiciously used in the design of new discrete two- and three-dimensional structures. The authors' last 15 years of work with the Pd(II)-cornered unit is summarized in this Account, from the spontaneous formation of a Pd4 square metal complex to a family of architectures such as cages, bowls, boxes, tubes, catenanes, and spheres.

        Microporous Metal-Organic Framework Based on Supermolecular Building Blocks (SBBs): Structure Analysis and Selective Gas Adsorption Properties
        Chang, Ze; Zhang, Da-Shuai; Hu, Tong-Liang; Bu, Xian-He
        Crystal Growth & Design (2011), 11 (6), 2050-2053CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        A new supermol. building block (SBB)-based microporous metal-org. framework (MOF) was prepd. with both 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylic acid (H3btc) and 2,4,6-tris(4-pyridyl)-1,3,5-triazine (tpt) as ligands. The obtained cobalt(II) MOF [Co9(btc)6(tpt)2(H2O)15] reveals an uncommon ftw-a-like structure from the assembly of cubohemioctahedra SBBs under the direction of tpt and exhibits selective gas adsorption properties depending on gas mol. diam. and temp. which might have application in gas sepn. purposes.

        4d
        Tuning Cobalt Coordination Architectures by Bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene Position Isomers and 5-Nitroisophthalate
        Zhu, Xia; Sun, Peng-Peng; Ding, Jian-Gang; Li, Bao-Long; Li, Hai-Yan
        Crystal Growth & Design (2012), 12 (8), 3992-3997CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        In order to tune the Co(II) coordination polymer architectures, three positional isomers 1,2-, 1,3-, 1,4-bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene and rigid 5-nitroisophthalate were used to assembly Co(II) coordination polymers [Co(obtz)(NO2-1,3-bdc)]n (1), [Co(mbtz)(NO2-1,3-bdc)(CH3OH)]n (2), and [Co(bbtz)(NO2-1,3-bdc)(H2O)]n (3). 1 Is comprised of undulated two-dimensional (2D) (4,4) networks. Two identical undulated layers are parallel interpenetrated to each other to give a (2D → 2D) polycatenated 2D network. The adjacent polycatenated 2D layers parallel polythreaded to form a unique 3D network. 1 Is an unusual 2D → 3D polythreaded framework based on the polycatenated 2D layers. 2 Shows the double-layer structure through the hydrogen bonds and π···π stacking interactions based on the undulated 2D (4,4) network. A 3D supramol. network is constructed through the π···π stacking interactions interdouble layers. 3 Exhibits a 3-fold interpenetrating 4-connected 65·8-CdSO4 3D network. The powder x-ray diffraction, thermal stabilities, and UV-visible spectroscopy of 1, 2, and 3 were investigated.

        4e
        Construction of Coordination Polymers Based on Bent 4-Amino-3,5-bis(3-carboxyphenyl)-1,2,4-triazole Ligand: Diverse Structural Topology and Photoluminescent and Magnetic Properties
        Li, Baiyan; Yang, Fen; Li, Guanghua; Liu, Dan; Zhou, Qi; Shi, Zhan; Feng, Shouhua
        Crystal Growth & Design (2011), 11 (5), 1475-1485CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        Ten coordination polymers, [Mn9(L1)8(OH)2(H2O)21]n (1), [Mn3.5(L1)3(OH)(H2O)8]n (2), [Cu(L1)(H2O)1.375]n (3), {Zn(L1)(DMF)[(CH3)2NH]0.25}n (4), [Zn2(L1)2(4,4'-bipy)(DMF)0.5(H2O)0.5]n (5), [Zn2(L1)2(bib)(H2O)6.75]n (6), [Cd2(L1)2(H2O)7.5]n (7), [Cd2(L1)2(H2O)7.5]n (8), [Cd(L1)(bpp)]n (9), and [Cd2(L1)2(bib)(H2O)6]n (10) (L1 = 4-amino-3,5-bis(3-carboxyphenyl)-1,2,4-triazole, bib = 1,4-bis(imidazol)butane, bpp = 1,3-bi(4-pyridyl)propane), were prepd. and structurally characterized. In these compds., L1 exhibits different coordination modes and conformations, constructing various architectures by bridging a variety of building units and adjusting the roles of different org. bases. Compd. 1 presents a 3D diamond topol. built by bridging rare Mn9 clusters with L1. Compd. 2 is a 1D chain structure. Compd. 3 shows a unique 2D {42.6}2{44.69.82} topol. by linking paddle-wheel SBU with L1. Compd. 4 is a 1D double chain structure. Compd. 5 presents an unusual 2D V2O5 net with {42.63.8}{42.6} topol. by linking 4,4'-bipy with the double chains constructed by L1 and Zn(II) atoms. Compd. 6 exhibits a rare 3D coe topol. with point (Schlafli) symbol for net: {42.6 × 102.12}{42.6}. Compd. 7 presents an unusual 1D strap shaped structure. Compd. 8 is a zero-periodic structure. Compd. 9 shows an interesting 4-connected 2D interpenetrating net with point (Schlafli) symbol {44.62}. Compd. 10 is a 1D "H" shaped structure when it is viewed from the c axis direction. The luminescent properties of compds. 4-7 and 9, and the magnetic properties of compd. 1 were studied in the solid state.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3MXksFaqsbk%253D&md5=508a6518bb4f1ef528011c45e43be121
      5. 5
        (a) Liu, D.; Lang, J. P.; Abrahams, B. F. J. Am. Chem. Soc. 2011, 133, 11042
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        5a
        Highly Efficient Separation of a Solid Mixture of Naphthalene and Anthracene by a Reusable Porous Metal-Organic Framework through a Single-Crystal-to-Single-Crystal Transformation
        Liu, Dong; Lang, Jian-Ping; Abrahams, Brendan F.
        Journal of the American Chemical Society (2011), 133 (29), 11042-11045CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
        The three-dimensional cryst. porous metal-org. framework [Ni2(μ2-OH2)(1,3-BDC)2(tpcb)]n (1) [1,3-H2BDC = 1,3-benzenedicarboxylic acid; tpcb = tetrakis(4-pyridyl)cyclobutane] was used to sep. a solid mixt. of naphthalene and anthracene at room temp. via selective adsorption of naphthalene. The process involved a single-crystal-to-single-crystal transformation. The guest naphthalene mols. could be exchanged with ethanol, and the host, 1, could be regenerated by removal of the guest ethanol mols.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3MXosVCrsbo%253D&md5=abc31b12f11a23b1ea59b214c1424839

        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        5b
        Zinc(II) and Cadmium(II) Complexes with 1,3,5-Benzenetricarboxylate and Imidazole-Containing Ligands: Structural Variation via Reaction Temperature and Solvent
        Luo, Li; Chen, Kai; Liu, Qing; Lu, Yi; Okamura, Taka-aki; Lv, Gao-Chao; Zhao, Yue; Sun, Wei-Yin
        Crystal Growth & Design (2013), 13 (6), 2312-2321CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        Five new metal complexes, [Zn3(L1)2(BTC)2]·6H2O (1), [Zn3(L1)(BTC)2] (2), [Cd3(L1)(BTC)2] (3), [Cd3(L2)(BTC)2]·4H2O (4), and [Cd3(L2)(BTC)2(H2O)2] (5), were successfully synthesized by solvothermal reactions of corresponding metal salts with 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylic acid (H3BTC) and imidazole-contg. ligands 1,3,5-tris(imidazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene (L1) and 3,3',5,5'-tetra(imidazol-1-yl)-1,1'-biphenyl (L2). The structures of the complexes were detd. by single crystal x-ray diffraction anal. Complexes 1 and 2 obtained at different reaction temps. show different structures: 1 is a three-dimensional (3D) net with Zn-BTC3- layers pillared by L1 ligands, while 2 has a 3D structure with a Zn-BTC3- framework and Zn-L1 chain. Complexes 2 and 3, which contain different metal centers, have similar framework structures but different coordination modes of carboxylate groups. 4 and 5 that were prepd. from different solvents show different 3D structures. The thermal stability, photoluminescence, and sorption properties of the complexes were studied.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3sXmsFGku7g%253D&md5=ce97ebbac2f5fe1b261b1c88534f8031
        (c) Li, M. X.; Miao, Z. X.; Shao, M.; Liang, S. W.; Zhu, S. R. Inorg. Chem. 2008, 47, 4481
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        5c
        Metal-Organic Frameworks Constructed from 2,4,6-Tris(4-pyridyl)-1,3,5-triazine
        Li, Ming-Xing; Miao, Zhi-Xin; Shao, Min; Liang, Sheng-Wen; Zhu, Shou-Rong
        Inorganic Chemistry (2008), 47 (11), 4481-4489CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        Five new metal-org. frameworks based on 2,4,6-tris(4-pyridyl)-1,3,5-triazine (tpt) ligand were hydrothermally synthesized. Reaction of tpt and AgNO3 in an acidic soln. at 180° yields {[Ag(Htpt)(NO3)]NO3·4H2O}n (1) in which Ag(I) is trigonally coordinated by two pyridyl N and one nitrato O to form a 1-dimensional zigzag chain. Reaction of tpt with CuSO4 affords {[Cu2(tpt)2(SO4)2(H2O)2]·4H2O}n (2) in which Cu(II) is bonded to two pyridyl N's, two sulfato O's, and two H2O O atoms to form an elongated octahedral geometry. Each H2O bridges two Cu(II), whereas sulfate bridges Cu(II) in μ-1,3 and μ-1,1 mode. The Cu(II)-sulfate-H2O 2-dimensional layers are linked by bidentate tpt to form a 3-dimensional polymeric structure. Reaction of Cu(SO4)2, tpt, and 1,2,4,5-benzenetetracarboxylic acid (H4btec) in the presence of piperidine gives [Cu(tpt)(H2btec)1/2]n (3). Cu(I) has a trigonal-pyramidal coordination environment with three pyridyl N's of tpt in a plane, whereas a carboxylate O is coordinated to the Cu(I) axially. The tpt-Cu forms a layer, and the layers are linked through H2btec2- to form a 2-dimensional double-layered coordination polymer. Replacing CuSO4 with ZnI2 in the synthesis gives {[Zn(tpt)(btec)1/2]·H2O}n (4). Zn(II) is in a distorted tetrahedral geometry and linked through bidentate tpt and exotetradentate btec4- to form a 2-dimensional coordination grid. Reaction of tpt with CuCN leads to the assembly of a 3-dimensional metal-org. framework [Cu3(CN)3(tpt)]n (5) in which Cu(I) is trigonally coordinated by one pyridyl N and two cyanides to form an intriguing honeycomb architecture. Luminescence studies show that 1, 3, 4, and 5 have blue fluorescence, which can be assigned to be ligand-centered emissions. Thermal anal. shows that all of these complexes are quite stable, and esp. for 4, the framework is stable up to 430°.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1cXlslOisbk%253D&md5=ee26796caeda61eca3fc8d37bf0beda7
        (d) Zhang, S. Q.; Jiang, F. L.; Wu, M. Y.; Ma, J.; Bu, Y.; Hong, M. C. Cryst. Growth Des. 2012, 12, 1452
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        5d
        Assembly of Discrete One-, Two-, and Three-Dimensional Zn(II) Complexes Containing Semirigid V-Shaped Tricarboxylate Ligands
        Zhang, Shu-Quan; Jiang, Fei-Long; Wu, Ming-Yan; Ma, Jie; Bu, Yang; Hong, Mao-Chun
        Crystal Growth & Design (2012), 12 (3), 1452-1463CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        Hydrothermal reaction of zinc nitrate, 4-(4-carboxyphenoxy)phthalic acid (H3cpop), and different N-donor coligands has afforded six novel supramol. compds., in which the nature of the neutral coligands plays a crucial structure-directing role. [Zn(Hcpop)(H2O)3]2 (1) and [Zn(Hcpop)(phen)(H2O)]2 (2, phen = 1,10-phenanthroline) form three-dimensional (3D) supramol. frameworks linked by H-bonds and π-π interactions based on discrete mols. Similarly, [Zn2(Hcpop)2(4,4'-bpy)3(H2O)2]n·4nH2O (3) possesses a 3-dimensional supramol. structure, aggregated by interesting 1-dimensional (1D) armed-polyrotaxane chains. [Zn6(cpop)4(4,4'-bpy)2(H2O)2]n (4, 4,4'-bpy = 4,4'-bipyridine) exhibits a complicated 3-dimensional framework which can be rationalized as a (3,6,6)-connected trinodal net with a unique (4.62)2(42.69.83.10)(44.68.83) topol. [Zn3(cpop)2(bpdb)(H2O)2]n (5, bpdb = 1,4-bis(4-pyridyl)-2,3-diaza-1,3-butadiene) is a 3-dimensional structure contg. two-dimensional (2D) metal-carboxylate layer motifs, which are further pillared by cpop3- and bpdb ligands to complete the structure. [Zn6(cpop)4(azpy)2(H2O)4]n (6, azpy = 4,4'-azopyridine) manifests a unique quadruple layer structure constructed from two types of bilayered architectures linked by Zn2+ ions and bridging azpy ligands. Solid-state properties such as thermal stability and the photoluminescence properties at room temp. for these complexes also were systematically studied.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC38XosFamsA%253D%253D&md5=9235b204d2cb4ece3be465f7d76bc7ba
      6. 6
        (a) Wu, M. Y.; Jiang, F. L.; Wei, W.; Gao, Q.; Huang, Y. G.; Chen, L.; Hong, M. C. Cryst. Growth Des. 2009, 9, 2559
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        6a
        A Porous Polyhedral Metal-Organic Framework Based on Zn2(COO)3 and Zn2(COO)4 SBUs
        Wu, Mingyan; Jiang, Feilong; Wei, Wei; Gao, Qiang; Huang, Yougui; Chen, Lian; Hong, Maochun
        Crystal Growth & Design (2009), 9 (6), 2559-2561CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        A porous polyhedral metal-org. framework [Zn7L2(OH)2(H2O)9]·12.25H2O (1) was constructed by using Zn2(COO)4 and Zn2(COO)3 SBUs as nodes and the flexible hexacarboxylate linker 5,5',5''-(2,4,6-trimethylbenzene-1,3,5-triyl)trismethylenetrisoxytriisophthalic acid (H6L). The framework contains four types of interconnected polyhedral cages, rhombic dodecahedron, tetrahedron, octahedron, and distorted tetragonal prism. To identify the topol. of the whole network, the four types of polyhedral cages can be viewed as nodes, and the whole network is signed as a (6,6,12,12) network. In another view of point, the Zn2(COO)3 SBU, Zn2(COO)4 SBU and hexacarboxylate ligands can also be considered as nodes, then the network is simply signed as a (3,4,6)-connected net with a Schlafli symbol (43) (4462) (4679).
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1MXlsVGrsLg%253D&md5=be37e405dc59c614bf7be29d96f235c5

        6b
        Unusual microporous polycatenane-like metal-organic frameworks for the luminescent sensing of Ln3+ cations and rapid adsorption of iodine
        Chen, Lei; Tan, Ke; Lan, Ya-Qian; Li, Shun-Li; Shao, Kui-Zhan; Su, Zhong-Min
        Chemical Communications (Cambridge, United Kingdom) (2012), 48 (47), 5919-5921CODEN: CHCOFS; ISSN:1359-7345. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        Two isostructural 2-dimensional 2-dimensional parallel 3-dimensional inclined interpenetrating polycatenane-like metal-org. frameworks, [Zn2L1(H2O)](NO3)·DMF (IFMC-10) and [Zn2L2(H2O)](NO3)·0.2DMF (IFMC-11) (H3L1 = 4',4'',4'''-(2,4,6-trimethylbenzene-1,3,5-triyl)tris(methyleneoxy)tribiphenyl-4-carboxylic acid, I) and (H3L2 = 4',4'',4'''-(2,4,6-trimethylbenzene-1,3,5-triyl) II) were successfully constructed based on length-adjusted tricarboxylate ligands. With the merit of being microporous, IFMC-10 can serve as host for encapsulating lanthanide cations (Eu3+, Sm3+ and/or Tb3+) to exhibit luminescent sensing and rapid adsorption of iodine.

        6c
        Three 3D Lanthanide-Organic Frameworks Based on Novel Flexible Multicarboxylates: From ssa to rtl Topologies
        Dai, Fangna; Sun, Di; Sun, Daofeng
        Crystal Growth & Design (2011), 11 (12), 5670-5675CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        Three lanthanide-org. frameworks were solvothermally synthesized and characterized. Complex 1 {[Pr2(bbda)(OH)2(H2O)6]·12H2O}n (H4bbda = 5,5'-(2,4,6-trimethyl-1,3-phenylene)bis(methylene)bis(oxy)diisophthalic acid) is a 3-dimensional porous framework belonging to a 2-nodal net with the ssa topol. The coordinated formate ligand from in situ hydrolyzation of DMF binds metal centers to generate rigid rod-shaped SBUs (secondary building units) in both complexes 2 and 3, [Ln(HCOO)(L1)(DMF)]n (Ln = Er (2), Tm (3), H2L1 = 2,2'-(2,3,5,6-tetramethyl-1,4-phenylene) bis(methylene)bis(sulfanediyl)dibenzoic acid, DMF = N,N'-DMF). The flexible ligand H4bbda in complex 1 exhibits syn conformation, while the flexible ligand H2L1 in complexes 2 and 3 adopts anti conformation. The anti L1 ligand links the rod-shaped SBUs to give 2 and 3 3-dimensional network with the rtl topol.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3MXhtl2ktL7N&md5=df1c26eec8ed5d2d9654dba8bbccb5b0
        (d) Shen, J. J.; Li, M. X.; Wang, Z. X.; Duan, C. Y.; Zhu, S. R.; He, X. Cryst. Growth Des. 2014, 14, 2818
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        6d
        Unexpected 4-Fold [2 + 2] Interpenetration and Polycatenation Behaviors in Porous Luminescent Zinc Metal-Organic Frameworks Constructed from Flexible 3,5-Bis(4-pyridylmethoxy)benzoate Ligand
        Shen, Jin-Jin; Li, Ming-Xing; Wang, Zhao-Xi; Duan, Chun-Ying; Zhu, Shou-Rong; He, Xiang
        Crystal Growth & Design (2014), 14 (6), 2818-2830CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        Six zinc metal-org. frameworks, namely, [Zn(bpmb)(HCOO)]n·[Zn(bpmb)(OH)]n·4nH2O (1), [Zn(bpmb)(HCOO)]n (2), [Zn2(bpmb)2(fum)]n·9nH2O (3), [Zn3(bpmb)2(D-cam)2]n (4), [Zn2(bpmb)(1,3,5-btc)]n·nDMA (5), and [Zn(bpmb)(1,2,4,5-H2btec)]n·4nH2O (6) (Hbpmb = 3,5-bis(4-pyridylmethoxy)benzoic acid; H2fum = fumaric acid; D-H2cam = D-camphoric acid; 1,3,5-H3btc = 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylic acid; 1,2,4,5-H4btec = 1,2,4,5-benzenetetracarboxylic acid; DMA = N,N-dimethylacetamide), were synthesized under solvothermal conditions. Their structures were characterized by EA, IR, PXRD, TG, and single-crystal XRD. Complex 1 is constructed of two independent neutral 3D MOFs with large 1D nanosized square channels, which are further entangled by each other to give an unexpected 4-fold [2 + 2] interpenetrating architecture. Complex 2 is a 3D MOF constructed from tetradentate bpmb and bidentate formate ligands, which is an isomer of the [Zn(bpmb)(HCOO)]n piece in 1. Complex 3 displays a 2D double-layered network that possesses 1D nanosized pores. Each 2D double layer is further interlocked with two neighboring ones to form an interesting 3D polycatenation array. Complex 4 possesses a 2D network constructed from a trinuclear [Zn3(COO)6N4] cluster and Zn-cam double-helical chain. Complex 5 is a 3D porous MOF constructed from tridentate bpmb and hexadentate 1,3,5-btc ligands. Complex 6 exhibits a 2-fold interpenetrating 2D wavelike (4,4) network constructed from bidentate bpmb and 1,2,4,5-H2btec ligands. The bpmb ligand adopts four types of coordination modes in 1-6. The secondary carboxylate ligands have obvious effects on their coordination architectures. Tetrahedral-, octahedral-, and trigonal-bipyramidal geometries around Zn(II) ions are obsd. A general solvothermal method is proposed for prepg. carboxylate complexes in DMF-H2O soln. without any basic additive. In the prepn. of 3, maleic acid is converted to a fumarate ligand. The thermal stabilities of six complexes and N2 adsorption behaviors of 1 and 3 are investigated. All the Zn(II) complexes emit blue luminescence originating from ligand-centered emission.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC2cXmvFeqt74%253D&md5=7280a0459f838a6a7f9bcc7b0d5d5838
        (e) Qin, L.; Hu, J. S.; Huang, L. F.; Li, Y. Z.; Guo, Z. J.; Zheng, H. G. Cryst. Growth Des. 20010, 10, 4176
        [ACS Full Text ], Google Scholar

        7b
        Solvent-Induced Synthesis of Zinc(II) and Manganese(II) Coordination Polymers with a Semirigid Tetracarboxylic Acid
        Qu, Ling-Ling; Zhu, You-Long; Li, Yi-Zhi; Du, Hong-Bin; You, Xiao-Zeng
        Crystal Growth & Design (2011), 11 (6), 2444-2452CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        By using a semirigid quadricarboxylate ligand 5,5'-(biphenyl-4,4'-diylbis(methylene))bis(oxy)diisophthalic acid (H4L), four novel coordination polymers were obtained solvothermally and characterized by single-crystal x-ray diffraction, thermogravimetric, photoluminescent and gas adsorption studies. Compd. [Zn2(L)]·CH3CN, 1, is a three-dimensional (3D) framework built from one-dimensional (1D) rod-shaped Zn-O-C secondary building units (SBUs) that are linked together by the 4-connecting L ligands to give rod packing of pcu type and elliptical channels of 7.7 × 8.4 Å2. Compd. [Zn4(L)2(H2O)4]·5H2O, 2, possesses a 3D open framework with a doubly interpenetrated sra net built from 4-connecting Zn2(OOC)4 unit and L ligand. Compd. [Mn2(L)(H2O)2]·2H2O, 3, is built from trigonal-bipyramidal binuclear Mn2(OOC)3 units and octadentate L ligands, forming a binodal 5,5-connected 43.66.8 net. Compd. [Mn(H2L)(DMA)(H2O)]·(DMA)(H2O), 4, is a two-dimensional (2D) layered structure made of 4-connecting mononuclear Mn atoms and half-deprotonated L ligands. N2 gas adsorption measurements at 77 K showed that compds. 1, 2, and 4 possess permanent porosities.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3MXlvFWjt7w%253D&md5=205a10d27569d34bd073ac0d0c2ab608
        (c) Zhao, S. N.; Su, S. Q.; Song, X. Z.; Zhu, M.; Hao, Z. M.; Meng, X.; Song, S. Y.; Zhang, H. J. Cryst. Growth Des. 2013, 13, 2756
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        7c
        A Series of Metal-Organic Frameworks Constructed From a V-shaped Tripodal Carboxylate Ligand: Syntheses, Structures, Photoluminescent, and Magnetic Properties
        Zhao, Shu-Na; Su, Sheng-Qun; Song, Xue-Zhi; Zhu, Min; Hao, Zhao-Min; Meng, Xing; Song, Shu-Yan; Zhang, Hong-Jie
        Crystal Growth & Design (2013), 13 (7), 2756-2765CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        Six novel complexes, namely, {[Zn1.5(L)(bix)0.5(H2O)]·H2O}n (1), {[Co1.5(L)(bix)0.5(H2O)]·H2O}n (2), {[Co3(L)2(4,4'-bpy)3]·5H2O}n (3), {[Cd3(L)2(4,4'-bpy)3]·4.5H2O}n (4), {[Cu3(L)2(4,4'-bpy)3]·3H2O}n (5), and {[Ni1.5(L)(4,4'-bpy)1.5(H2O)3]·2H2O}n (6) were synthesized by the hydrothermal reaction of 5-(4-carboxy-2-nitrophenoxy)isophthalic acid (H3L) with different transition metal ions in the presence of ancillary ligands, 1,4-bis(imidazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene (bix) and 4,4'-bipyridine (4,4'-bpy). Complexes 1 and 2 are isostructural, possessing a (3,8)-connected tfz-d type topol. with the Schlaefli symbol of {43}2{46·618·84}. The 3-dimensional structures of complexes 3-5 are very similar to complex 1 with only a little difference of the H3L coordination motif in complexes 4 and 5. The authors also use 4,4'-bpy instead of bix as the ancillary ligand in all three complexes. Complex 6 is a mixed 1-dimensional chain and two-dimensional sheet structure, which are further linked to each other in a three-dimensional framework by H-bond interactions. All the complexes were characterized by single crystal x-ray diffraction, IR spectroscopy, TG anal., and elemental anal. The luminescent properties of complexes 1 and 4 are discussed, and the magnetic properties of complexes 2 and 3 are also studied.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3sXptFegtrY%253D&md5=9ad749547fb5d889c0b8484ab0641ae8
        (d) Guo, Z. G.; Cao, R.; Wang, X.; Li, H.-F.; Yuan, W.-B.; Wang, G.-J.; Wu, H.-H.; Li, J. J. Am. Chem. Soc. 2009, 131, 6894
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        7d
        A Multifunctional 3D Ferroelectric and NLO-Active Porous Metal-Organic Framework
        Guo, Zhengang; Cao, Rong; Wang, Xin; Li, Hongfang; Yuan, Wenbing; Wang, Guojian; Wu, Haohan; Li, Jing
        Journal of the American Chemical Society (2009), 131 (20), 6894-6895CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
        The tetracarboxylate org. linker H4X = tetrakis[4-(carboxyphenyl)oxamethyl]methane acid and Zn(II) ions assemble into chiral building blocks for a porous metal-org. framework [Zn2(X)(MeCH2OH)] (1) with ferroelec. and second-order nonlinear optical properties. The crystallog. structure, pore size, enthalpy of hydrogen adsorption, surface area, thermal decompn., NLO properties, ferroelec. properties and dielec. permittivity of 1 were studied.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1MXlsFCns7o%253D&md5=b736cc714944177fbfbef021b1a91e52
        (e) Hu, J. S.; Yao, X. Q.; Zhang, M. D.; Qin, L.; Li, Y. Z.; Guo, Z. J.; Zheng, H. G.; Xue, Z. L. Cryst. Growth Des. 2012, 12, 3426
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        7e
        Syntheses, Structures, and Characteristics of Four New Metal-Organic Frameworks Based on Flexible Tetrapyridines and Aromatic Polycarboxylate Acids
        Hu, Jin-Song; Yao, Xiao-Qiang; Zhang, Ming-Dao; Qin, Ling; Li, Yi-Zhi; Guo, Zi-Jian; Zheng, He-Gen; Xue, Zi-Ling
        Crystal Growth & Design (2012), 12 (7), 3426-3435CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        Solvothermal reactions of tetrakis(4-pyridyloxymethylene)methane (TPOM) with deprotonated isophthalic acid (1,3-H2bdc), 5-hydroxyisophthalic acid (5-OH-H2bdc), benzene-1,3,5-tricarboxylic acid (H3btc), and benzene-1,2,4,5-tetracarboxylic acid (H4btc) in the presence of zinc and cobalt salts produce four new complexes, namely, {[Co2(TPOM)(bdc)2(H2O)2]·(H2O)3}n (1), {[Zn2(TPOM)(5-OH-bdc)2]·(DMF)(H2O)2}n (2), {[Co3(TPOM)(btc)2(H2O)]·(H2O)4}n (3), and [Zn2(TPOM)(btc)2]n (4). Complexes 1 and 2 possess similar 2-fold interpenetrating three-dimensional (3D) framework with bbf topol., but 1 crystallizes in an achiral space group, and 2 crystallizes in chiral space group and displays ferroelec. behavior. Complex 3 reveals a 3D framework with binuclear Co clusters, which displays weak antiferromagnetic character. In complex 4, only H4btc links Zn(II) to generate a 3D porous framework, with TPOM occupying the void space as countercation and template. In addn., photochem. and ferroelec. properties of these new complexes in the solid state have been studied.

        Perry, J. J., IV; Kravtsov, V. C.; McManus, G. J.; Zaworotko, M. J. J. Am. Chem. Soc. 2007, 129, 10076
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        8
        Bottom up Synthesis That Does Not Start at the Bottom: Quadruple Covalent Cross-Linking of Nanoscale Faceted Polyhedra
        Perry, John J., IV; Kravtsov, Victor Ch.; McManus, Gregory J.; Zaworotko, Michael J.
        Journal of the American Chemical Society (2007), 129 (33), 10076-10077CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
        A novel 3-dimensional metal-org. coordination polymer constructed from hollow, spherical, nanometer-sized mol. faceted polyhedra and a flexible tetracarboxylate ligand designed to simultaneously assemble and cross-link these nanoballs in situ was synthesized and structurally characterized. The crystal structure involves 2-fold interpenetration with each framework exhibiting pores of dimensions which vary from <1 nm to just over 2.5 nm.

        9a
        Hydrothermal Synthesis, Structures, and Physical Properties of Four New Flexible Multicarboxylate Ligands-Based Compounds
        Pan, Zhaorui; Zheng, Hegen; Wang, Tianwei; Song, You; Li, Yizhi; Guo, Zijian; Batten, Stuart R.
        Inorganic Chemistry (2008), 47 (20), 9528-9536CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        Four new compds. of partially or wholly deprotonated 5,5'-(1,4-phenylenebis(methylene))bis(oxy)diisophthalic acid (H4L1) and 5,5'-(1,3-phenylenebis(methylene))bis(oxy)diisophthalic acid (H4L2), {[Co(L1)0.5]·(H2O)2}n (1), {[Mn(L1)0.5]·(H2O)2}n (2), {[Cu(H2L1)](μ2-bipy)}n (bipy = 4,4'-bipyridyl) (3), and {[Zn2(L2)].H2O}n (4) were synthesized in the presence or absence of auxiliary bipy ligand. Their structures were detd. by single-crystal x-ray diffraction anal. and further characterized by elemental anal., IR spectra, and TGA. Compds. 1 and 2 are isostructural and possess three-dimensional (3D) networks. In compd. 3, multicarboxylate ligands and bipy ligands link Cu centers to generate a two-dimensional (2D) sheet structure which is further connected by intermol. hydrogen bonds to form a 3-dimensional supramol. structure. In compd. 4, the Zn centers are connected by L24- anions to generate a 3-dimensional framework. Magnetic susceptibility measurements indicate that compds. 1 and 2 exhibit antiferromagnetic coupling between adjacent Co(II) ions and Mn(II) ions. The photoluminescent properties of the free H4L1 and H4L2 ligands and compd. 4 were studied in the solid state at room temp. Both ligands and compd. 4 exhibit strong violet emissions. Compared with the fluorescent emission of the ligand, the emission of 4 is red shifted and enhanced.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1cXhtFGntr3J&md5=78d3e89f95eab133b052beb754125dbf

        9b
        Structural diversity and properties of coordination polymers built from a semi-rigid tetradentate carboxylic acid
        Qu, Ling-Ling; Zhu, You-Long; Zhang, Jun; Li, Yi-Zhi; Du, Hong-Bin; You, Xiao-Zeng
        CrystEngComm (2012), 14 (3), 824-831CODEN: CRECF4; ISSN:1466-8033. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        By using a semi-rigid tetracarboxylate ligand 5,5'-(1,4-phenylenebis(methylene))bis(oxy)diisophthalic acid (H4L), three novel coordination polymers were synthesized solvothermally and characterized by single-crystal x-ray diffraction, thermogravimetric, photoluminescent and gas adsorption studies. Compd. [Zn(H2L)(H2O)2] (1) is a two-dimensional (2D) network with sql/Shubnikov topol. built from the 4-connecting Zn2(OOC)2 cluster and bridging ligand H2L2-. Compd. [Co2(H3L)2(H2L)(H2O)2]·5H2O (2) is a one-dimensional (1D) zigzag chain-like polymer made of 2-connecting ligand H2L2- and Co2O6(H2O)4 clusters, which form a 3D network through hydrogen bonding interactions. [Cd3(L)2]·(H3O)2(H2O)(DMF)4 (3) possesses a rare (4,8)-connected flu (CaF2) net built from 8-connecting Cd3 clusters and 4-connecting L ligands. In three complexes, the ligand H4L exhibits diverse coordination configurations and modes owing to its flexibility. Upon excitation at room temp., complexes 1 and 3 exhibit strong violet and blue emissions, resp. N2 gas adsorption measurements at 77 K showed that compd. 3 possesses permanent porosities.
        >> More from SciFinder ®

        10a
        Tuning Different Kinds of Entangled Networks Formed by Isomers of Bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene and a Flexible Tetracarboxylate Ligand
        He, Xiang; Lu, Xiao-Peng; Li, Ming-Xing; Morris, Russell E.
        Crystal Growth & Design (2013), 13 (4), 1649-1654CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        To tune the Zn(II) coordination polymer architectures, three positional isomers, 1,4- (pbtmb), 1,3- (mbtmb), and 1,2-bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene (obtmb), and flexible tetracarboxylate ligand, 5,5'-(1,4-phenylenebis(methylene))bis(oxy)diisophthalic acid (H4L1), were used to assemble compds. with different kinds of entangled networks, namely, {[Zn2(L1)(pbtmb)2]·4H2O}n (1), {[Zn2(L1)(mbtmb)2]·4H2O}n (2), and [Zn2(L1)(obtmb)2]n (3). Flexible bis(triazole) ligands present diverse conformations in these compds. Compd. 1 shows a 4-fold interpenetrating three-dimensional architecture with 4-connected mog (moganite) topol. Compd. 2 displays a 2-dimensional + 2-dimensional → 3-dimensional polycatenation network simplified as new 4-connected topol. with the Schlafli notation of {4,64;8}2{42,64}. Compd. 3 is a 2-dimensional polythreading structure, in which two layed networks interpenetrate in a (2D/2D) parallel fashion. The powder x-ray diffraction, thermal stabilities, and the photoluminescence of 1-3 also were studied.

        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3sXjvVKksrw%253D&md5=ac244fc348f46fbac078c384993a6ff9

        10b
        Syntheses, structures, and photoluminescent properties of ten metal-organic frameworks constructed by a flexible tetracarboxylate ligand
        He, Xiang; Lu, Xiao-Peng; Ju, Zhan-Feng; Li, Chun-Ju; Zhang, Qi-Kai; Li, Ming-Xing
        CrystEngComm (2013), 15 (14), 2731-2744CODEN: CRECF4; ISSN:1466-8033. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        Reactions of Zn ions with the flexible tetracarboxylate ligand, 5,5'-(1,4-phenylenebis(methylene))bis(oxy)diisophthalic acid (H4L1) gave rise to 10 complexes, namely {[Zn3(L1)(OH)2(H2O)2]3H2O}n (1), {[Zn(H2L1)(H2O)2]H2O}n (2), [Zn2(L1)(H2O)4]n (3), {[Zn2(H3L1)2(H2L1)(H2O)2(MeCN)2]}n (4), [Zn2(H3L1)2(H2L1)(2,2'-bipy)2]n (5), [Zn2(H3L1)2(H2L1)(1,10-phen)2]n (6), {[Zn2(L1)(4,4'-bipy)2]4H2O}n (7), {[Zn2(L1)(bpe)2]4H2O}n (bpe = 1,2-bi(4-pyridyl)ethene) (8), {[Zn2(L1)(pdp)2]4H2O}n (pdp = 4-[(E)-4-pyridinylazo]pyridine) (9) and {[Zn2(L1)(bpmp)2]6H2O}n (bpmp = N,N'-bis-(4-pyridylmethyl)piperazine) (10). The H4L1 ligand not only displayed different deprotonated forms, but also diverse coordination modes and conformations. Compds. 1-4 are constructed of only Zn atoms with H4L1 ligands while compds. 5-10 are constructed of Zn atoms and H4L1 ligands with various N-donor ligands. Compd. 1 features a 3D architecture constructed of a linear Zn3 cluster with H4L1 ligands. Compd. 2 is a 2D waved layer structure with (4,4) grid as sql topol. Compd. 3 displays a 3D network simplified by a (3,6)-connected 2-nodal net with ant topol. Compds. 4, 5, and 6 all exhibit 1D infinite chains coordination structure, in which the H4L1 ligand is displayed as 2 kinds of deprotonated forms. Compds. 7, 8, 9, and 10 are similar and possess (4,4)-connected 3D frameworks with benzo[b]fluoranthene topol., while also exhibiting an intriguing 3-fold interpenetrated structure. These results indicate that subtle environmental factors, such as solvent, pH value and neutral auxiliary ligands play important roles in the formation of the structures of the final framework. At the same time, the photochem. properties of compds. 1-10 were tested in the solid state at room temp., and the luminescent properties of compd. 9 and 10 when dispersed in different solvents were investigated. These showed solvent-dependent luminescent spectra with emission intensities significantly quenched towards nitrobenzene. The quenching effects are obsd. at a low nitrobenzene concn. of 200 ppm, which indicates high sensitivities of these compds. towards nitrobenzene.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3sXjslKgsLw%253D&md5=3205649ea065cd28dd39691bccae5829

        (a) Meng, Z. S.; Yun, L.; Zhang, W. X.; Hong, C. G.; Herchel, R.; Ou, Y. C.; Leng, J. D.; Peng, M. X.; Lin, Z. J.; Tong, M. L. Dalton Trans. 2009, 10284
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        11a
        Reactivity of 4-amino-3,5-bis(pyridin-2-yl)-1,2,4-triazole, structures and magnetic properties of polynuclear and polymeric Mn(II), Cu(II) and Cd(II) complexes
        Meng, Zhao-Sha; Yun, Lei; Zhang, Wei-Xiong; Hong, Chao-Gang; Herchel, Radovan; Ou, Yong-Cong; Leng, Ji-Dong; Peng, Meng-Xia; Lin, Zhuo-Jia; Tong, Ming-Liang
        Dalton Transactions (2009), (46), 10284-10295CODEN: DTARAF; ISSN:1477-9226. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        Five new complexes were obtained from soln. or hydrothermal reactions of M(OAc)2 (M = Mn, Cu and Cd) or CuCl2 with 4-amino-3,5-bis(pyridin-2-yl)-1,2,4-triazole (abpt) and NaN3 or 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylic acid (btcH3) in different molar ratios. Structural anal. reveals that Cd(abpt) units in [Cd(abpt)(μ1,1-N3)2]n (1) are bridged by double μ1,1 end-on (EO) azides into 1-dimensional zigzag coordination chains. Similar structural motifs, i.e. the chelation of abpt to the metal center and the double bridges of EO azides, are found in [Mn4(abpt)4(μ1,1-N3)8(H2O)2] (2). The terminal aqua mols. and the monodentate N3- groups give a tetranuclear complex rather than a polymeric compd. The abpt underwent deamination in the presence of copper ions during the process of coordination and became 3,5-bis(pyridin-2-yl)-1,2,4-triazolate (bpt-H) in 3-5. [Cu4(bpt-H)4(N3)4]·4.5H2O (3) is a neutral tetranuclear grid-like complex, in which the azides act as monodentate ligands. A similar [Cu4(bpt-H)4]4+ grid-like unit was found in [Cu4(bpt-H)4(μ-btcH)Cl2]·2H2O (4) and a pair of symmetry-related copper atoms are bridged by the μ-btcH2- coligand in a butterfly-shaped structure. In [Cu2(bpt-H)(μ6-btc)(H2O)]n (5), the tetranuclear {Cu4(μ-bpt-H)2(μ3-carboxylate)2}4+ units are bridged by μ6-btc3- ligands in a 2-dimensional step-like layer structure. Temp.-dependent magnetic susceptibility measurements reveal that the double μ1,1-N3- bridges in 2 transmit the ferromagnetic interactions between Mn2+ centers (J1 = J2 = +3.09(4) cm-1, gMn(ii) = 2.02(1)), and the μ-(bpt-H)- bridges transmit moderate antiferromagnetic interactions in both 3 (J = -12.78(13) cm-1) and 4 (J1 = -14.96(11) cm-1). In 4 the antiferromagnetic coupling via the μ-btcH2- bridge is the 2nd coupling pathway (J2 = -9.48(7) cm-1). The coexistence of ferromagnetic and antiferromagnetic coupling between four Cu2+ centers occurs in 5 (J1 = -0.88(3) cm-1 and J2 = +5.01(2) cm-1). The magneto-structural relation for tetranuclear copper pyrazolate/triazolate compds. is discussed.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1MXhsVamsbrL&md5=64b9afae4b08431a1c7c1cebd670f126
        (b) Yang, P.; He, X.; Li, M. X.; Ye, Q.; Ge, J. Z.; Wang, Z. X.; Zhu, S. R.; Shao, M.; Cai, H. L. J. Mater. Chem. 2012, 22, 2398
        [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar

        The first homochiral coordination polymer with temperature-independent piezoelectric and dielectric properties
        Yang, Peng; He, Xiang; Li, Ming-Xing; Ye, Qiong; Ge, Jia-Zhen; Wang, Zhao-Xi; Zhu, Shou-Rong; Shao, Min; Cai, Hong-Ling
        Journal of Materials Chemistry (2012), 22 (6), 2398-2400CODEN: JMACEP; ISSN:0959-9428. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        Two homochiral coordination polymers [Mn2(D-cam)2(2-Hpao)4]n (1) (2-Hpao = 2-pyridinealdoxime) and [Co2(D-cam)2(3-abpt)2(H2O)3]n·5nH2O (2) (3-abpt = 4-amino-3,5-bis(3-pyridyl)-1,2,4-triazole) were prepd. with D-(+)-camphoric acid (H2D-cam) and characterized by X-ray crystal structural anal. The 1-D complex 1 featured good temp.-independent piezoelec. (6.9 pC N-1) and dielec. properties.

        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC38Xnslyqug%253D%253D&md5=1c86a3aa92b322949543fab566b1ebf1

        11c
        Chiral Coordination Polymers with SHG-Active and Luminescence: An Unusual Homochiral 3D MOF Constructed from Achiral Components
        Chen, Na; Li, Ming-Xing; Yang, Peng; He, Xiang; Shao, Min; Zhu, Shou-Rong
        Crystal Growth & Design (2013), 13 (6), 2650-2660CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        Six new coordination polymers, namely, [Cd(SO4)(4-abpt)(H2O)]n·3nH2O (1), [Cu3(CN)3(4-abpt)2]n (2), [Cd(D-cam)(2-PyBIm)(H2O)]n (3), [Co(D-Hcam)(cptpy)]n (4), [Cd(D-cam)(btmb)]n (5), and [Cd2(D-cam)(L-cam)(btmbb)]n (6) (4-abpt = 4-amino-3,5-bis(4-pyridyl)-1,2,4-triazole, D-H2cam = d-camphoric acid, 2-PyBIm = 2-(2-pyridyl)benzimidazole, Hcptpy = 4'-(4-carboxyphenyl)-3,2':6',3''-terpyridine, btmb = 1,4-bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene, btmbb = 4,4'-bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-ylmethyl)-1,1'-biphenyl), were synthesized under hydro(solvo)thermal conditions. Their structures were detd. by single-crystal x-ray diffraction anal. and further characterized by elemental anal., IR spectra, powder X-ray diffraction, CD, and TGA. Complex 1 features a 3-dimensional porous metal-org. framework, which is a rare example to obtain a homochiral compd. from achiral components. Complex 2 exhibits a 2-dimensional polymeric network constructed from μ2-cyanide, μ2-4-abpt, and monodentate 4-abpt ligands. Complex 3 is a homochiral 1-dimensional helical chain polymer. Complex 4 displays a 1-dimensional ladder-like polymeric structure in which cptpy- is tetradentate and D-Hcam- acts as a side arm. Complex 5 displays a homochiral 2-dimensional network with (4,4) topol. Complex 6 shows a [Cd2(D-cam)(L-cam)]n (4,4)-connected network with a paddle-wheel Cd2(COO)4 as node, which is further pillared by a btmbb spacer into a 3-dimensional metal-org. framework. d-Camphoric acid underwent racemization under hydrothermal conditions. Cd(II) complexes 1, 3, and 5 crystallize in chiral space groups, and their CD spectra exhibit obvious pos. or neg. Cotton effects. Also, 1, 3, and 5 are SHG-active, and the SHG efficiency, resp., is 0.15, 0.4, and 0.4 times as much as that of KH2PO4. All the complexes exhibit relatively high thermal stability. 1, 3, 5, And 6 emit violet luminescence originating from ligand-centered emission.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3sXmvVygur8%253D&md5=467d3c4d49084f49e6b2e45d2a0cb436
        (d) Huang, F. P.; Zhang, Q.; Yu, Q.; Bian, H. D.; Liang, H.; Yan, S. P.; Liao, D. Z.; Cheng, P. Cryst. Growth Des. 2012, 12, 1890
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        11d
        Coordination Assemblies of CoII/NiII/ ZnII/CdII with Succinic Acid and Bent Connectors: Structural Diversity and Spin-Canted Antiferromagnetism
        Huang, Fu-Ping; Zhang, Qian; Yu, Qing; Bian, He-Dong; Liang, Hong; Yan, Shi-Ping; Liao, Dai-Zheng; Cheng, Peng
        Crystal Growth & Design (2012), 12 (4), 1890-1898CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        Four bent ligands, (i) 4,4'-abpt, (ii) 4,4'-Hbpt, (iii) 3,4'-Hbpt, and (iv) 3,3'-Hbpt, as well as H2suc (succinic acid) were used to construct seven coordination polymers: [Co(suc)(4,4'-abpt)(H2O)]·2H2O (1), [M(suc)(4,4'-Hbpt)(H2O)]·2H2O (M = Co for 2, Ni for 3), [Cd(suc)(4,4'-Hbpt)2(H2O)2] (4), [Co(suc)(3,4'-Hbpt)(H2O)3]·H2O (5), [Zn(suc)(3,4'-Hbpt)] (6), and [Zn(suc)0.5(3,3'-bpt)(H2O)] (7) (4,4'-abpt = 4-amino-3,5-bis(4-pyridyl)-1,2,4-triazole, 4,4'-Hbpt = 1H-3,5-bis(4-pyridyl)-1,2,4-triazole, 3,4'-Hbpt = 1H-3-(3-pyridyl)-5-(4-pyridyl)-1,2,4-triazole, and 3,3'-Hbpt = 1H-3,5-bis(3-pyridyl)-1,2,4-triazole). The crystal structure anal. reveals that 1-3 form similar two-dimensional (2D) layer structures, where the adjacent metal centers are connected by a syn-anti carboxylate bridge from suc ligands to furnish a succinate-metal chain, which is further interlinked by bent ligands. 4-7 form different 1-dimensional chains via suc anions, and bpt isomers display versatile coordination modes. The magnetic behavior of compds. 1-3 and 5 was studied, and it indicated the existence of interesting spin-canting behavior, where the bent ligands tilting the neighbor metal center could give further contribution to the canting effect. The luminescent properties of 4, 6, and 7 were studied in the solid state at room temp.

        12b
        Cyclic water pentamer in a tape-like structure
        Ma, Bao-Qing; Sun, Hao-Ling; Gao, Song
        Chemical Communications (Cambridge, United Kingdom) (2004), (19), 2220-2221CODEN: CHCOFS; ISSN:1359-7345. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        A novel water tape consisting of fused cyclic water pentamers has been obsd. in a supramol. compd. within a pyridine dioxide moiety and structurally characterized. The observation of great consistence of geometry and structural parameters between our pentamer and the already established cyclic geometry of the isolated water pentamer provides important solid state evidence which supports the cyclic puckered ring geometry of the water pentamer. Given the importance of pentamer-like patterns of water in solvation of hydrophobic solutes, in the structures of clathrate hydrates and in biol. macromols., the novel water tapes may provide inisight into the nature of aq. solvation, the structure and behaviors of bulk water and implication in living'systems.

        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2cXotVOmsrY%253D&md5=8eb00a90fc8b5340fc3db94d7314a016
