      14. 14
        Lu, J. K. Coord. Chem. Rev. 2003, 246, 327
        [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
        14
        Crystal engineering of Cu-containing metal-organic coordination polymers under hydrothermal conditions
        Lu, Jack Y.
        Coordination Chemistry Reviews (2003), 246 (1-2), 327-347CODEN: CCHRAM; ISSN:0010-8545. (Elsevier Science B.V.)
        A review is presented on Cu-contg. polymeric coordination compds. synthesized under hydrothermal conditions. The rapid growth of hydrothermal synthesis of new coordination polymers is largely accredited to the developments in crystal engineering via functional network design. Both projected and unexpected framework structures were obtained through oxidn., redn., substitution, chem. rearrangement and regular hydrothermal reactions. New methods and reaction pathways play crucial roles in the formation of novel structures and topol. under hydrothermal conditions. This review covers copper iodine-contg. metal-org. coordination polymers, copper pyridylcarboxylate-contg. metal-org. coordination polymers, and metastable coordination polymers with active copper open metal (OM) sites.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD3sXpt1Gitrg%253D&md5=d86f5892df8afee4d776a485d1472faf
      15. 15
        (a) Xue, Y. S.; Jin, F. Y.; Zhou, L.; Liu, M. P.; Xu, Y.; Du, H. B.; Fang, M.; You, X. Z. Cryst. Growth Des. 2012, 12, 6158
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        15a
        Structural Diversity and Properties of Coordination Polymers Built from a Rigid Octadentenate Carboxylic Acid
        Xue, Yun-Shan; Jin, Feng-Yan; Zhou, Lian; Liu, Mei-Pin; Xu, Yan; Du, Hong-Bin; Fang, Min; You, Xiao-Zeng
        Crystal Growth & Design (2012), 12 (12), 6158-6164CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        By using a rigid octadentate carboxylate linker 5,5',5'',5'''-silanetetrayltetraisophthalic acid (H8L), three new microporous coordination polymers, namely, [Cu4L(H2O)4]·2DMF·10H2O (1), [Zn5L2(H2O)4][NH2Me2]6·2DMF·4H2O (2), and [Cd3(H2L)2][NH2Me2]6·4DMF·14H2O (3), were solvothermally synthesized and structurally characterized. Compd. 1 is a 3-dimensional framework built from a square paddlewheel [Cu2(O2CR)4] and a 8-connected cube L ligand to give a (4,8)-connected scu structure. Compd. 2 is a 3-dimensional 4-nodal (4,4,4,8)-connected network with small 1-dimensional channels built on three tetrahedral Zn units and a 8-connecting ligand L. Compd. 3 possesses a 3-dimensional structure with a (4,4,6)-connected net built on two tetrahedral Cd units and a 6-connecting ligand H2L6-. All the three compds. consist of large solvent accessible voids, but only compd. 1 possesses permanent porosity as confirmed by N2, H2, O2, CO2 and CH4 gas adsorption measurements. Compds. 2 and 3 exhibited strong blue fluorescent emissions with a peak at 414 and 412 nm, resp., at RT upon excitation owing to a ligand-centered excited state.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC38Xhs1KnurjE&md5=43887eefe3efd2165e0d8a14d2308882
        (b) Burrows, A. D.; Cassar, K.; Düren, T.; Friend, R. M. W.; Mahon, M. F.; Rigby, S. P.; Savarese, T. L. Dalton Trans. 2008, 2465
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        15b
        Syntheses, structures and properties of cadmium benzenedicarboxylate metal-organic frameworks
        Burrows, Andrew D.; Cassar, Kevin; Duren, Tina; Friend, Richard M. W.; Mahon, Mary F.; Rigby, Sean P.; Savarese, Teresa L.
        Dalton Transactions (2008), (18), 2465-2474CODEN: DTARAF; ISSN:1477-9226. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        The products isolated from the reaction between Cd(NO3)2·4H2O and 1,4-benzenedicarboxylic acid (H2bdc) in DMF are very dependent on the conditions. At 115°, the reaction gives [Cd(bdc)(DMF)]∞ 1, which has a three-dimensional network structure, whereas at 95°, 1 is formed alongside [Cd3(bdc)3(DMF)4]∞ 2, which has a two-dimensional network structure. When the reaction is carried out under pressure, it yields [Cd3(bdc)3(DMF)4]∞ 3, which is a supramol. isomer of 2. The structure of 3 differs from that of 2 regarding the way the Cd3(O2CR)6 units are interlinked to form layers. When the reaction was carried out in DMF that had undergone partial hydrolysis, the only isolated product was {(NMe2H2)2[Cd(bdc)2]·2DMF}∞ 4. Compd. 4 has a three-dimensional triply-interpenetrated diamondoid structure, with dimethylammonium cations and DMF mols. included within the pores. The reaction between Cd(NO3)2·4H2O and H2bdc in DEF gave [Cd(bdc)(DEF)]∞ 5, regardless of the solvent quality. Compd. 5 has a three-dimensional network structure. The reaction of Cd(NO3)2·4H2O and 1,3-benzenedicarboxylic acid (H2mbdc) in DMF gave [Cd(mbdc)(DMF)]∞ 6 which has a bilayer structure. The thermal properties of the new materials were studied, and the coordinated DEF mols. from 5 can be removed on heating to 400° without any change in the powder x-ray diffraction pattern. The H2 sorption isotherm for the desolvated material shows marked hysteresis between adsorption and desorption, and less adsorption than predicted by simulations. Kinetic data indicate that the hysteresis is not due to mass transfer limitations, and the most likely explanation for this behavior lies in partial collapse of the framework to an amorphous phase under the conditions of activation.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1cXlsVGltbg%253D&md5=7bd95d32b187bc372c8fda86b1a95b8b
        (c) Hu, F. L.; Wu, W.; Liang, P.; Gu, Y. Q.; Zhu, L. G.; Wei, H.; Lang, J. P. Cryst. Growth Des. 2013, 13, 5050
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        15c
        Construction of Entangled Coordination Polymers Based on M2+ Ions, 4,4'-{[1,2-Phenylenebis(methylene)]bis(oxy)}dibenzoate and Different N Donor Ligands
        Hu, Fei-Long; Wu, Wei; Liang, Peng; Gu, Yun-Qiong; Zhu, Li-Gang; Wei, Han; Lang, Jian-Ping
        Crystal Growth & Design (2013), 13 (11), 5050-5061CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        Reactions of several transition metal [M = Mn(II), Cu(II), Zn(II), Co(II)] salts with 4,4'-{[1,2-phenylenebis(methylene)]bis(oxy)}dibenzoic acid (H2L) and auxiliary N-donor ligands afforded a series of entangled coordination frameworks, [Mn2L2(4,4'-bpy)2][Mn2L2(H2O)2]·2H2O (1), [CuL(bbm)]·0.5H2O (2), [CuL(4,4'-bpy)0.5] (3), [Zn3L2(4,4'-bpy)2(HCOO)2] (4), [ZnL(4,4'-bpy)]2·H2O (5), [Co4L4(bpp)2]·DMF (6), [Co2L2(bbm)]2·2H2O (7), and [CoL(2,2'-bpy)] (8) [2,2'-bpy = 2,2'-bipyridine; 4,4'-bpy = 4,4'-bipyridine; bbm = 1,4-bis(1H-imidazol-1-yl)benzene; bpp = 1,3-bis(4-pyridyl)propane]. Their structures were characterized by elemental anal., IR spectra, and TGA and further detd. by single-crystal x-ray diffraction anal. Compd. 1 has an uncommon 2Dlayer + 1Dchain → 3D framework, while 2 displays a 2-fold interpenetrated 3D framework. Compds. 3-5 show different entangled networks though they adopt the same 4,4'-bpy as the auxiliary ligand. Compds. 3 and 5 show 2-fold interpenetrated 2D networks, showing both polycatenane and polyrotaxane characters. Compd. 4 possesses a 2D → 3D polythreaded architecture. Compd. 6 has a 3-fold interpenetrated 3D framework by using bpp as the second ligand. Compd. 7 presents a 3D framework with a (44·62·88·12)(44·62)(8) topol. Compd. 8 presents a 1D helical chain constructed by linking [Co(2,2'-bpy)]2+ units via L ligands. The results provided an interesting insight into how metal ions, auxiliary N-donor ligands, and molar ratios of the components exert great impact on the formation of these entangled networks. The thermal and luminescent properties of 1-8 in solid state at ambient temp. were also investigated.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3sXhsV2ltbvI&md5=474c3066e4f13546b6710d5eb11ea903
      16. 16
        (a) Zheng, B.; Luo, J.; Wang, F.; Peng, Y.; Li, G.; Huo, Q.; Liu, Y. Cryst. Growth Des. 2013, 13, 1033
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        16a
        Construction of Six Coordination Polymers Based on a 5,5'-(1,2-Ethynyl)bis-1,3-benzenedicarboxylic Ligand: Synthesis, Structure, Gas Sorption, and Magnetic Properties
        Zheng, Bing; Luo, Jiahuan; Wang, Fang; Peng, Yu; Li, Guanghua; Huo, Qisheng; Liu, Yunling
        Crystal Growth & Design (2013), 13 (3), 1033-1044CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        Six novel coordination polymers based on a multifunctional ligand, 5,5'-(1,2-ethynyl)bis-1,3-benzenedicarboxylic (H4EBDC), namely, |(DMF)2(H2O)7(C2H5OH)3|[Zn2(EBDC)(bipy)2] (1), |(DMF)3(H2O)30(MeCN)2|[Zn6(EBCDC)3(Odbco)2] (2), |(DMF)2(H2O)2(H3O)2|[Cd3(EBDC)2] (3), |(DMF)|[Mn(H2EBDC)(DMF)2] (4), |(DMF)2(H2O)(C2H7N)3|[Mn6(HEBDC)4(H2O)8] (5), and [Mn2(EBDC)(DMF)2] (6), were constructed under solvothermal conditions and structurally characterized by single-crystal x-ray diffraction. In these compds., the ligand, H4EBDC, exhibits different coordination modes and conformations, constructing various architectures by bridging a variety of metal ions or polynuclear clusters. Compd. 1 forms a three-dimensional (3D) FSC network constructed from two-dimensional (2D) layer motifs joined by EBDC4- and 4,4'-bipyridine bridges. Compd. 2 possesses an NbO topol. by linking Zn2(CO2)4 units with the ligand, coordinated amine mols. fill the pores, while compd. 3 exhibits a 3D FLU network with Cd2+ as the cation and features an infinite framework built from tricadmium clusters. Compd. 4 is based on PtS net, constructed of 4-connected rectangular H4EBDC units with tetrahedral monometallic Mn(CO2)4 nodes. Compd. 5 is composed of 2D layers with (3,6)-connected KGD topol., and compd. 6 consists of a 3D PtS-X network, built by bridging a metal chain with the ligand. The structures of these compds. are discussed together with their corresponding properties, such as gas storage, sepn., and magnetic properties.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3sXhtFWlt7w%253D&md5=9a569ce0cd50e8fae03cf83db64b45ae
        (b) Yang, P.; Wang, M. S.; Shen, J. J.; Li, M. X.; Wang, Z. X.; Shao, M.; He, X. Dalton Trans. 2014, 43, 1460
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        16b
        Seven novel coordination polymers constructed by rigid 4-(4-carboxyphenyl)-terpyridine ligands: synthesis, structural diversity, luminescence and magnetic properties
        Yang, Peng; Wang, Meng-Si; Shen, Jin-Jin; Li, Ming-Xing; Wang, Zhao-Xi; Shao, Min; He, Xiang
        Dalton Transactions (2014), 43 (3), 1460-1470CODEN: DTARAF; ISSN:1477-9226. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        Seven coordination polymers, namely [Mn(4-cptpy)2]n (1), [Co(4-cptpy)2]n (2), [Mn3(4-cptpy)6(H2O)]n·2nH2O (3), [Co(4-cptpy)(HCOO)(H2O)]n·nDMF (4), [Zn2(4-Hcptpy)2Cl4]n·2nC2H5OH·nH2O (5), [Co4(3-cptpy)4(HCOO)4(H2O)2]n (6), and [Mn(3-cptpy)2]n (7) (4-Hcptpy = 4-(4-carboxyphenyl)-4,2':6',4''-terpyridine; 3-Hcptpy = 4-(4-carboxyphenyl)-3,2':6',3''-terpyridine), were synthesized under hydro(solvo)thermal conditions and structurally characterized. A general solvothermal method is proposed for prepg. carboxylate complexes in DMF soln. without any basic additive. 1 And 2 possess isostructural 3D metal-org. frameworks contg. nanosized cavities. 3 Is a beautiful 2D coordination polymer assembled by flower-like Mn3(4-cptpy)6(H2O) subunits. 4 And 6 both display 2D polymeric networks constructed from 4/3-cptpy- ligands, in which the formate ligands originate from the hydrolysis of DMF. 5 is a 1D 21 helical chain polymer. 7 Shows a 2D network with a (3.6) two-nodal kgd topol. 4/3-Hcptpy ligands display seven types of coordination modes. The zinc complex 5 emits strong violet luminescence. 1 And 2 are both thermally stable < 440° and exhibit antiferromagnetic interactions.

        (a) Searle, G. H.; Hambley, T. W. Aust. J. Chem. 1982, 35, 1297

        18a
        The preparation and characterization of mer-bis[bis(3-aminopropyl)amine]cobalt(III) perchlorate and the crystal structure of its hydrolysis product bis[bis(3-aminopropyl)amine]tri-μ-hydroxy-dicobalt(III) perchlorate
        Searle, Graeme H.; Hambley, Trevor W.
        Australian Journal of Chemistry (1982), 35 (7), 1297-309CODEN: AJCHAS; ISSN:0004-9425.
        mer-[Co(dpt)2]Cl3 [dpt = bis(3-aminopropyl)amine] was obtained from substitution or oxidn. reactions in nonaq. solvents, and transformed to the perchlorate salt. The 13C NMR spectrum indicates high conformational mobility and the coupled 6-membered chelate rings of the mer structure. Slow hydrolysis occurs in neutral H2O, and the hydrolysis product was isolated. The s-fac and u-fac-[Co(dpt)2]3+ isomers were not detected chromatog. in the prepns., and any isomerization of the mer isomer is masked by the hydrolysis. X-ray crystallog. anal. shows that the isolated hydrolysis product is the racemic geometric isomer (C2 symmetry) of [(dpt)Co(OH)3Co(dpt)](ClO4)3. Each facially coordinated dpt adopts the ring conformations chair, irregular-boat. The crystals are monoclinic, space group P21/n, with a 5.053(5), b 13.964(2), c 14.010(3) Å, β 109.90(2)°. The structure was refined by blocked-matrix least-squares techniques to an R factor (3190F) of 0.032.

        18b
        Base hydrolysis of (1,4,7-triazacyclononane)(3-thiapentane-1,5-diamine)cobalt(III) and the crystal and molecular structure of sodium tri-μ-hydroxobis{1,4,7-triazacyclononanecobalt(III)} dichloride diperchlorate dihydrate isolated from the reaction
        Larsen, Erik; Larsen, Sine; Paulsen, Gudrun; Springborg, Johan; Wang, Dong Ni
        Acta Chemica Scandinavica (1994), 48 (2), 107-12CODEN: ACHSE7; ISSN:0904-213X.
        The reaction between the cation (1,4,7-triazacyclononane)(3-thiapentane-1,5-diamine)cobalt(III), Co(tacn)(daes)3+, and hydroxide at 59 °C was studied spectrophotometrically and with ion-exchange high-performance liq. chromatog. A study of the hydrolysis of 0.002-0.06 M solns. of Co-(tacn)(daes)3+ in 1 M NaOH shows that the system has two dominant equil.: Co(tacn)(daes)3+ + 3 HO- kf ↹ kb Co(tacn)(OH)3 + daes with equil. const. Kh, and 2 Co(tacn)(OH)3 ↹ (tacn)Co(OH)3Co(tacn)3+ + 3 HO- with equil. const. Kd. The following equil. and rate consts. were detd.: Kh = 0.08(2) M-2, Kd = 17(3) M2 and kobsf = 1.02(2) × 10-3 s-1 in 1 M NaOH at 59 °C. From the reaction mixt. Na[(tacn)Co(OH)3Co(tacn)]Cl2(ClO4)2.2H2O was isolated. The structure was detd. from low-temp. (122 K) x-ray diffraction data: a = 7.235(5) Å, b = 17.662(2) Å, c = 20.870(6) Å, β = 93.41(3)°, Z = 4, space group P21/c, Rw = 0.092. The double salt compn. seems important for crystal stability. The dinuclear cation has the expected triol structure.

        [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
        19
        Synthesis, structure, and spectroscopic properties of copper(II) compounds containing nitrogen-sulfur donor ligands: the crystal and molecular structure of aqua[1,7-bis(N-methylbenzimidazol-2'-yl)-2,6-dithiaheptane]copper(II) perchlorate
        Addison, Anthony W.; Rao, T. Nageswara; Reedijk, Jan; Van Rijn, Jacobus; Verschoor, Gerrit C.
        Journal of the Chemical Society, Dalton Transactions: Inorganic Chemistry (1972-1999) (1984), (7), 1349-56CODEN: JCDTBI; ISSN:0300-9246.
        The complexes [CuL(OH2)][ClO4]2 (I) and CuL(ClO4)2.2H2O (II) of the linear quadridentate N2S2 donor ligand III (L) were prepd.; they are significantly more stable towards autoredn. than the nonmethyl analogs. The structure of I was detd. by x-ray crystallog.; results were refined to an R of 0.047 for 3343 reflections. The Cu coordination is intermediate between trigonal bipyramidal and square pyramidal. In the solid state the coordination sphere in II may be a topoisomer of I. A new angular structural parameter, τ, is defined as an index of trigonality, a general descriptor of 5-coordinate centric mols. By this criterion the coordination of I in the solid state is described as 48% along the path of distortion from square pyramidal to trigonal bipyramidal. The S → Cu charge-transfer bands in the electronic spectrum of I are assigned. ESR and ligand field spectra show that the Cu compds. adopt a tetragonal structure in donor solvents.

        20
        Controlling interpenetration in metal-organic frameworks by tuning the conformations of flexible bis(triazole) ligands
        He, Xiang; Lu, Xiao-Peng; Tian, Yu-Yang; Li, Ming-Xing; Zhu, Shourong; Xing, Feifei; Morris, Russell E.
        CrystEngComm (2013), 15 (45), 9437-9443CODEN: CRECF4; ISSN:1466-8033. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        Solvothermal syntheses afforded two new MOFs {[Zn2(L1)(btmbb)(H2O)4]·2H2O}n (1) and [Zn2(L1)(btmbb)2]n (2) [5,5'-(1,4-phenylenebis(methylene))bis(oxy)diisophthalic acid (H4L1), and 4,4'-bis((1H-1,2,4-triazol-1-yl)methyl)biphenyl (btmbb)]. Single crystal x-ray analyses reveal that compd. 1 shows an example of a 2-dimensional noninterpenetrating network, while compd. 2 is a 2-dimensional polythreading interpenetrating structure, in which two layered networks interpenetrate in a (2D/2D) parallel fashion. The different conformation of the flexible ligand might be the main factor resulting in these noninterpenetrated/interpenetrated structures. The powder x-ray diffraction, thermal stabilities, and the photoluminescence of 1-2 also were studied.

        (a) Saha, H. L.; Mitra, S. Thermochim. Acta 1987, 116, 53
        [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
        21a
        Thermal decomposition reactions of metal carboxylato complexes in the solid state. III. Thermographic and differential thermal studies of metal oxalato, malonato and succinato complexes
        Saha, H. L.; Mitra, S.
        Thermochimica Acta (1987), 116 (), 53-64CODEN: THACAS; ISSN:0040-6031.
        Li2[ML2].mH2O (H2L = oxalic, malonic, and succinic acids; M = Mn, Fe, Co, Ni, Cu, Zn, Cd; m = 0, 2, 3, 4, 6, or 7) and Li3[FeL3].nH2O (n = 3 or 6) were prepd. and their thermal properties in the solid state were studied under nonisothermal conditions in a N atm. by simultaneous TG and DTA. The decompn. took place in single or multiple steps and thermal stability of the complex decreased, approx., with the increase of the std. potential of the central metal ion. Activation energy (Ea*), enthalpy change (ΔH), and entropy change (ΔS) for dehydration and decompn. were detd. A linear correlation was found between ΔH and ΔS, and Ea* and ΔS, in dehydration and decompn. processes. An irreversible phase transition was obsd. for Li2[Co(suc)2] (H2suc = succinic acid) in the DTA curve. The residual products were mixts. of Li2CO3 and metal oxides except Li2[Mn(C2O4)2], Li2[Zn(mal)2] (H2mal = malonic acid), and Li2[Cd(mal)2], where the final products were Li2O.MnO2, Li2CO3.ZnCO3, and Li2CO3.CdCO3 mixts., resp.
        >> More from SciFinder ®

        [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
        21b
        Unusual metal-organic network constructed from Zn(II), benzenetricarboxylate and bis(1,2,4-triazolyl)pyridine
        Liang, Sheng-Wen; Li, Ming-Xing; Shao, Min; Liu, Hong-Jiang
        Inorganic Chemistry Communications (2007), 10 (11), 1347-1350CODEN: ICCOFP; ISSN:1387-7003. (Elsevier B.V.)
        Hydrothermal reaction of ZnSO4·7H2O with 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylic acid (H3btc) and 2,6-bis(1,2,4-triazol-4-yl)pyridine (btp) afforded a novel metal-org. network, {[Zn3(btc)2(btp)2(H2O)2]·4H2O}n (1), with a supramol. cocrystal, [H3btc·btp·H2O]n (2). The complex 1 exhibits an unusual network contg. two mol. squares and a rectangle. The networks interpenetrate to make a 3-dimensional metal-org. framework, which is quite thermal stable. Compd. 2 shows a 2-dimensional supramol. network assembled through strong hydrogen bonds.

        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2sXhtF2qsbfK&md5=18c750051c963a54c17e7a66cf82ef99
      22. 22
        (a) Roy, P.; Dhara, K.; Manassero, M.; Ratha, J.; Banerjee, P. Inorg. Chem. 2007, 46, 6405
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        22a
        Selective Fluorescence Zinc Ion Sensing and Binding Behavior of 4-Methyl-2,6-bis(((phenylmethyl)imino)methyl)phenol: Biological Application
        Roy, Partha; Dhara, Koushik; Manassero, Mario; Ratha, Jagnyeswar; Banerjee, Pradyot
        Inorganic Chemistry (Washington, DC, United States) (2007), 46 (16), 6405-6412CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        Zinc ion fluorescence sensing and the binding properties of 4-methyl-2,6-bis(((phenylmethyl)imino)methyl)phenol (HL) have been investigated. It displays high selectivity for Zn2+ and can be used as zinc ion-selective luminescent probe for biol. application under physiol. conditions. The increase in emission in the presence of Zn2+ is accounted for by the formation of hexanuclear complex [Zn6(L)2(OH)2(CH3COO)8] characterized by x-ray crystallog. An approx. 6-fold Zn2+-selective chelation-enhanced fluorescence response in HEPES buffer (pH 7.4) is attributed due to the strong coordination of Zn(II) that would impose rigidity and hence decrease the nonradiative decay of the excited state. By incubation of cultured living cells (B16F10 mouse melanoma and A375 human melanoma) with HL, intracellular Zn2+ concn. could be monitored.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2sXnsVehuro%253D&md5=513d14ad96c9c811d193a7d4e2b4c01c
        (b) Wang, H. Y.; Gao, S.; Huo, L. H.; Ng, S. W.; Zhao, J. G. Cryst. Growth Des. 2008, 8, 665
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        22b
        Three interpenetrated frameworks assembly from a long multicarboxylate ligand and transition metal
        Wang, Huan-Yu; Gao, Shan; Huo, Li-Hua; Ng, Seik Weng; Zhao, Jing-Gui
        Crystal Growth & Design (2008), 8 (2), 665-670CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        Three three-dimensional polymers, namely, [Zn(bpea)(H2O)]n (1, H2bpea = biphenylethene-4,4'-dicarboxylic acid), [Cd(bpea)(H2O)]n (2) and [Ni(bpea)(4,4'-bipyridine)(pyridine)]n (3) have been synthesized by the hydrothermal reaction of ZnII, CdII or NiII salts with biphenylethene-4,4'-dicarboxylic acid, and their mol. structures have been detd. using X-ray crystallog. Complexes 1 and 2 have a 2-fold interpenetrating three-dimensional (3D) structure with Pts topol. and complex 1 exhibits strong fluorescent emission bands at 435 and 459 nm in the solid state at room temp. Complex 3 is a 3D structure with an unprecedented 9-fold interpenetrated Ths topol.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1cXksV2gsw%253D%253D&md5=8e1774bc66c7d550a927503a01ff6715
      23. 23
        Allendorf, M. D.; Bauer, C. A.; Bhakta, R. K.; Houk, R. J. T. Chem. Soc. Rev. 2009, 38, 1330
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        23
        Luminescent metal-organic frameworks
        Allendorf, M. D.; Bauer, C. A.; Bhakta, R. K.; Houk, R. J. T.
        Chemical Society Reviews (2009), 38 (5), 1330-1352CODEN: CSRVBR; ISSN:0306-0012. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        A review; metal-org. frameworks (MOFs) display a wide range of luminescent behaviors resulting from the multifaceted nature of their structure. In this crit. review we discuss the origins of MOF luminosity, which include the linker, the coordinated metal ions, antenna effects, excimer and exciplex formation, and guest mols. The literature describing these effects is comprehensively surveyed, including a categorization of each report according to the type of luminescence obsd. Finally, we discuss potential applications of luminescent MOFs. This review will be of interest to researchers and synthetic chemists attempting to design luminescent MOFs, and those engaged in the extension of MOFs to applications such as chem., biol., and radiation detection, medical imaging, and electro-optical devices.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1MXkvVamurg%253D&md5=9219edb8997dd29d5f61edbe8e99797d
      24. 24
        Zhang, S. H.; Ma, L. F.; Zou, H. H.; Wang, Y. G.; Liang, H.; Zeng, M. H. Dalton Trans. 2011, 40, 11402
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        24
        Anion induced diversification from heptanuclear to tetranuclear clusters: Syntheses, structures and magnetic properties
        Zhang, Shu-Hua; Ma, Lu-Fang; Zou, Hua-Hong; Wang, Yin Guang; Liang, Hong; Zeng, Ming Hua
        Dalton Transactions (2011), 40 (43), 11402-11409CODEN: DTARAF; ISSN:1477-9226. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        Three new polynuclear complexes, [Co7(bm)12]·(ClO4)2·13H2O (1), [Co4(bm)4Cl4(C3H7OH)4] (2), and [Co4(bm)4(μ-HCO2)2(μ2-HCO2)2(C3H7OH)2] (3) (Hbm = 1H-benzimidazole-2-methanol), were synthesized and characterized by elemental anal., IR, powder x-ray diffraction and X-ray single-crystal diffraction. Compd. 1 features a centrosym. wheel-like heptanuclear Co(II) cluster. Compd. 2 having a I41/a space group exhibits a tetranuclear Co(II) cluster with a cubane topol. in which the central Co(II) ion and oxygen atoms from bm occupy the alternate vertexes of the cube. However, compd. 3 has a tetranuclear Co(II) cluster with a C2/c space group different from that of compd. 2. The geometries and sizes of the corresponding anions as well as their coordinating and hydrogen-bonding properties are essential in detg. the final structures of the assemblies. Magnetic properties of 1-3 in the 2-300 K also are discussed. The {Co7} (1) and {Co4} (2) cores display dominant ferromagnetic interactions while the {Co4} (3) core displays dominant antiferromagnetic interactions.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3MXhtlKisrbE&md5=958f4d75fa7fb3b46a4e093345bc4f1c
      25. 25
        (a) Mukherjee, S.; Samanta, D.; Mukherjee, P. S. Cryst. Growth Des. 2013, 13, 5335
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        25a
        New Structural Topologies in a Series of 3d Metal Complexes with Isomeric Phenylenediacetates and 1,3,5-Tris(1-imidazolyl)benzene Ligand: Syntheses, Structures, and Magnetic and Luminescence Properties
        Mukherjee, Sandip; Samanta, Dipak; Mukherjee, Partha Sarathi
        Crystal Growth & Design (2013), 13 (12), 5335-5343CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        The authors present the syntheses, characterizations, magnetic and luminescence properties of five 3d-metal complexes, [Co(tib)(1,2-phda)]n·(H2O)n (1), [Co3(tib)2(1,3-phda)3(H2O)]n·(H2O)2n (2), [Co5(tib)3(1,4-phda)5(H2O)3]n·(H2O)7n (3), [Zn3(tib)2(1,3-phda)3]n·(H2O)4n (4), and [Mn(tib)2(H2O)2]n·(1,4-phdaH)2n·(H2O)4n (5), obtained from the use of isomeric phenylenediacetates (phda) and the neutral 1,3,5-tris(1-imidazolyl)benzene (tib) ligand. Single crystal x-ray structures showed that 1 constitutes 3,5-connected 2-nodal nets with a double-layered two-dimensional (2D) structure, while 2 forms an interpenetrated 2D network (3,4-connected 3-nodal net). Complex 3 has a complicated three-dimensional structure with 10-nodal 3,4,5-connected nets. Complex 4, although it resembles 2 in stoichiometry and basic building structures, forms a very different overall 2D assembly. In complex 5 the dicarboxylic acid, upon losing only one of the acidic protons, does not take part in coordination; instead it forms a complicated hydrogen bonding network with water mols. Magnetic susceptibility measurements over a wide range of temps. revealed that the metal ions exchange very poorly through the tib ligand, but for the Co(II) complexes the effects of nonquenched orbital contributions are prominent. The 3d10 metal complex 4 showed strong luminescence with λmax = 415 nm (for λex = 360 nm).
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3sXhslWnsrbF&md5=f6286e0d9711e09201a495291ce4973f
        (b) Canaj, A. B.; Tzimopoulos, D. I.; Philippidis, A.; Kostakis, G. E.; Milios, C. J. Inorg. Chem. 2012, 51, 10461
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        25b
        Employment of a New Tripodal Ligand for the Synthesis of Cobalt(II/III), Nickel(II), and Copper(II) Clusters: Magnetic, Optical, and Thermal Properties
        Canaj, Angelos B.; Tzimopoulos, Demetrios I.; Philippidis, Aggelos; Kostakis, George E.; Milios, Constantinos J.
        Inorganic Chemistry (2012), 51 (19), 10461-10470CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        The employment of 2-hydroxy-1-naphthaldehyde 1,1-bis(hydroxymethyl)ethanamine Schiff base (LH3) in cobalt, nickel, and copper chem. gave five new metallic complexes with interesting magnetic properties. More specifically, the reaction of Co(OAc)2·4H2O with LH3 in MeOH in the presence of NEt3 under solvothermal conditions forms the complex [CoIII2CoII3(L)2(LH)2(L')(OAc)]·8.5MeOH (1·8.5MeOH; L' = monoanion of 2-hydroxy-1-naphthaldehyde), while in nickel chem., a similar reaction of Ni(OAc)2·6H2O with LH3 in MeCN in the presence of NEt3 under high pressure/temp. forms the complex [NiII(LH2)2]·2MeCN (2·2MeCN). Repeating the same reaction in MeOH and switching from Ni(OAc)2·4H2O to NiSO4·4H2O produces the complex [NiII4(HL)3(OMe)(MeOH)3](SO4)0.5·2MeOH (3·2MeOH) under solvothermal conditions. Furthermore, in copper chem., the reaction of Cu2(OAc)4·2H2O with LH3 in the presence of NEt3 in MeOH under solvothermal conditions affords the complex [CuII4(LH)4] (4), while the same reaction under ambient temp. and pressure conditions forms [CuII4(LH)4]·3.5MeOH·2.25H2O (5·3.5MeOH·2.25H2O). Complex 1 is a mixed-valent [CoIII2CoII3] complex, consisting of three edge-sharing [Co3] triangles. Complex 2 is a nickel(II) monomer in which the central metal is found in an octahedral geometry, while complex 3 describes a [NiII4] cubane. Complexes 4 and 5 may be considered as structural isomers because they possess the same formulas but different topologies: 4 describes a highly distorted [CuII4(OR)4]4+ eight-membered ring, while 5 consists of a distorted [CuII4(μ3-OR)4]4+ cubane. In addn., 5 can be converted to 4 in excellent yield under solvothermal conditions. Direct-current magnetic susceptibility studies have been carried out in the 5-300 K range for complexes 1 and 3-5, revealing the possibility of a high-spin ground state for 1, an S = 4 ground state for 3, and diamagnetic ground states for 4 and 5.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC38XhtlOjtL7J&md5=adfe8119fc2384a2316aa5279ed87fe7
        (c) Arora, H.; Barman, S. K.; Lloret, F.; Mukherjee, R. Inorg. Chem. 2012, 51, 5539
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        25c
        Isostructural Dinuclear Phenoxo-/Acetato-Bridged Manganese(II), Cobalt(II), and Zinc(II) Complexes with Labile Sites: Kinetics of Transesterification of 2-Hydroxypropyl-p-nitrophenylphosphate
        Arora, Himanshu; Barman, Suman K.; Lloret, Francesc; Mukherjee, Rabindranath
        Inorganic Chemistry (2012), 51 (10), 5539-5553CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        Using the dinucleating phenol-based ligand 2,6-bis[3-(pyridin-2-yl)pyrazol-1-ylmethyl]-4-methylphenol (HL2), in its deprotonated form, the six new dinuclear complexes [MII2(L2)(μ-O2CMe)2(MeCN)2][PF6] (M = Mn (2a), Co (3a), Zn (4a)) and [MII2(L2)(μ-O2CMe)2(MeCN)2][BPh4] (M = Mn (2b), Co (3b), Zn (4b)) were synthesized. Crystallog. analyses on 2b·2MeCN, 3b·2MeCN, and 4b·2MeCN reveal that these complexes have closely similar μ-phenoxo bis(μ-carboxylato) structures. The physicochem. properties (absorption and ESI-MS spectral data, 2a,b, 3a,b, and 4a,b; 1H NMR, 4a,b) of the cations of 2a-4a are identical with those of 2b-4b. Each metal ion is terminally coordinated by a pyrazole N and a pyridyl N from a 3-(pyridin-2-yl)pyrazole unit and a solvent mol. (MeCN). Thus, each metal center assumes distorted-octahedral MIIN3O3 coordination. Temp.-dependent magnetic studies on MnII and CoII dimers reveal intramol. antiferromagnetic (J = -8.5 cm-1) for 2b and ferromagnetic exchange coupling (J = +2.51 cm-1) for 3b, from the Hamiltonian H = -JS1·S2. The exchange mechanism is discussed from magneto-structural parameters (M···M distance). Spectroscopic properties of the complexes also were studied. The pH titrn. and kinetics of phosphatase (transesterification) activity on 2-hydroxypropyl-p-nitrophenyl phosphate (HPNP) were studied in MeOH/H2O (33%, vol./vol.) with 2a-4a, due to soly. reasons. This comparative kinetic study revealed the effect of the metal ion on the rate of hydrolysis of HPNP, which was compared with what the authors recently reported for [NiII2(L2)(μ-O2CMe)2(MeOH)(H2O)][ClO4] (1a). The efficacy in the order of conversion of substrate to product (p-nitrophenolate ion) follows the order 4a > 3a > 2a > 1a, under identical exptl. conditions. Notably, this trend follows the decrease of pKa values of MII-coordinated H2O (7.95 ± 0.04 and 8.78 ± 0.03 for 1a, 7.67 ± 0.08 and 8.69 ± 0.06 for 2a, 7.09 ± 0.05 and 8.05 ± 0.06 for 3a, and 6.20 ± 0.04 and 6.80 ± 0.03 for 4a). The stronger the Lewis acidity (Zeff/r) of the metal ion, the more acidic is the MII-coordinated H2O and the greater is the propensity of the metal ion to catalyze hydrolysis of the activated phosphate ester HPNP. Notably, the obsd. k2 values (M-1 s-1) for MnII (2a, 0.152), CoII (3a, 0.208), and ZnII (4a, 0.230) complexes (1a, 0.058; already reported) linearly correlate with Zeff/r values of the metal ion. In each case a pseudo-first-order kinetic treatment was done. Kinetic data anal. of complexes 2a-4a were also done following Michaelis-Menten treatment (catalytic efficiency kcat/KM values 0.170M-1 s-1 for 2a, 0.194M-1 s-1 for 3a and 0.161M-1 s-1 for 4a; for 1a the value is 0.089M-1 s-1). Temp.-dependent measurements were done to evaluate kinetic/thermodn. parameters for the hydrolysis/transesterification of HPNP and yielded comparable activation parameters (Ea (kJ mol-1): 71.00 ± 4.60 (1a; reported), 67.95 ± 5.71 (2a), 62.60 ± 4.46 (3a), 67.80 ± 3.25 (4a)) and enthalpy/entropy of activation values (ΔH⧺ (kJ mol-1) = 68.00 ± 4.65 (1a; reported), 65.40 ± 5.72 (2a), 60.00 ± 4.47 (3a), 65.29 ± 3.26 (4a); ΔS⧺ (J mol-1 K-1) = -109.00 ± 13 (1a; reported), -107.30 ± 16 (2a), -122.54 ± 14 (3a), -104.67 ± 10 (4a)). The Ea values for all the complexes are comparable, suggesting a closely similar reaction barrier, meaning thereby similar course of reaction. The ΔS⧺ values are consistent with an associative process. Pos. ΔH⧺ values correspond to bond breaking of the activated complex as a result of nucleophilic attack at the P atom, releasing cyclic phosphate and p-nitrophenolate ion. These data have helped the authors to propose a common mechanistic pathway: deprotonation of a metal-bound species to form the effective nucleophile, binding of the substrate to the metal center(s), intramol. nucleophilic attack on the electrophilic P atom with the release of the leaving group, and possibly regeneration of the catalyst.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC38XmtFSqur8%253D&md5=1b1ece42bc3b587fe90b6b4229d28d1c
      26. 26
        (a) Daumann, L. J.; Comba, P.; Larrabee, J. A.; Schenk, G.; Stranger, R.; Cavigliasso, G.; Gahan, L. R. Inorg. Chem. 2013, 52, 2029
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        26a
        Synthesis, Magnetic Properties, and Phosphoesterase Activity of Dinuclear Cobalt(II) Complexes
        Daumann, Lena J.; Comba, Peter; Larrabee, James A.; Schenk, Gerhard; Stranger, Robert; Cavigliasso, German; Gahan, Lawrence R.
        Inorganic Chemistry (2013), 52 (4), 2029-2043CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        Dinuclear Co(II) complexes were prepd. and characterized to generate functional and spectroscopic models for Co(II) substituted phosphoesterase enzymes such as the potential bioremediator GpdQ. Reaction of ligands based on 2,2'-(((2-hydroxy-5-methyl-1,3-phenylene)bis(methylene))bis((pyridin-2-ylmethyl)azanediyl))diethanol (L1) and 2,6-bis(((2-methoxyethyl)(pyridin-2-ylmethyl)amino)methyl)-4-methylphenol (L2) with Co(II) salts afforded [Co2(CO2EtH2L1)(CH3COO)2](PF6), [Co2(CO2EtL2)(CH3COO)2](PF6), [Co2(CH3L2)(CH3COO)2](PF6), [Co2(BrL2)(CH3COO)2](PF6), and [Co2(NO2L2)(CH3COO)2](PF6). Complexes of the L2 ligands contain a coordinated Me-ether, whereas the L1 ligand contains a coordinated alc. The complexes were characterized using mass spectrometry, microanal., x-ray crystallog., UV-visible-NIR diffuse reflectance spectroscopy, IR absorption spectroscopy, solid state magnetic susceptibility measurements, and variable-temp. variable-field MCD (VTVH MCD) spectroscopy. Susceptibility studies show that [Co2(CO2EtH2L1)(CH3COO)2](PF6), [Co2(CO2EtL2)(CH3COO)2](PF6), and [Co2(CH3L2)(CH3COO)2](PF6) are weakly antiferromagnetically coupled, whereas [Co2(BrL2)(CH3COO)2](PF6) and [Co2(NO2L2)(CH3COO)2](PF6) are weakly ferromagnetically coupled. The susceptibility results are confirmed by the VTVH MCD studies. D. functional theory calcns. revealed that magnetic exchange coupling occurs mainly through the phenolic O bridge. Implications of geometry and ligand design on the magnetic exchange coupling is discussed. Functional studies of the complexes with the substrate bis(2,4-dinitrophenyl) phosphate showed them to be active towards hydrolysis of phosphoester substrates.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3sXhslamurk%253D&md5=39e6fb1601d8ecc3518d91b3e754646d
        (b) Niu, C. Y.; Zheng, X. F.; Wan, X. S.; Kou, C. H. Cryst. Growth Des. 2011, 11, 2874
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        26b
        A Series of Two-Dimensional Co(II), Mn(II), and Ni(II) Coordination Polymers with Di- or Trinuclear Secondary Building Units Constructed by 1,1'-Biphenyl-3,3'-Dicarboxylic Acid: Synthesis, Structures, and Magnetic Properties
        Niu, Cao-Yuan; Zheng, Xian-Fu; Wan, Xin-Sheng; Kou, Chun-Hong
        Crystal Growth & Design (2011), 11 (7), 2874-2888CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        Hydro/solvothermal and bilayered-diffusion methods using pyridine (py), 3-methylpyridine (3-mpy), and 4-methylpyridine (4-mpy) as weak bases and small terminal ligands generated seven CoII, MnII, and NiII two-dimensional (2D) coordination polymers with di-, trinuclear metal clusters as secondary building units (SBUs) from an org. bridging ligand, 1,1'-biphenyl-3,3'-dicarboxylic acid (H2L). Coordination polymers based on trinuclear SBUs are {[Co3(L)3(py)2](py)}n (1) and [Mn3(L)3(py)2(H2O)2]n (4), and those based on dinuclear SBUs are {[Co2(L)2(py)3(H2O)2](py)(CH3OH)}n (2), [Ni2(L)2(py)4(H2O)]n (3), {[Mn2(L)2(py)3(H2O)2](py)2(CH3CH2OH)}n (5), {[Mn2(L)2(3-mpy)4(H2O)](CH3OH)0.5}n (6), and [Mn2(L)2(4-mpy)2]n (7). Further structural anal. indicates that 1, 4, and 7 have a (4,4) grid layered structure and 2, 3, 5, and 6 possess a (3,6) sheet structure. Magnetization studies show the existence of ferromagnetic coupling for 1 with a pos. zJ value of 0.97 cm-1, weak antiferromagnetic coupling for 2 (-E2/k = -4.6 K), very weak antiferromagnetic coupling for 3 with a small neg. J value of -0.17 cm-1, weak or medium antiferromagnetic couplings for 4, 5, and 6 with the neg. J values of -1.17, -1.53, and -1.62 cm-1, resp., and very strong antiferromagnetic coupling for 7 with a very large neg. J value of -16.62 cm-1.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3MXmtlyltrY%253D&md5=aa6af40a91a815d58c9224a7f28aa86a
      27. 27
        Huang, W. H.; Yang, G. P.; Chen, J.; Chen, X.; Zhang, C. P.; Wang, Y. Y.; Shi, Q. Z. Cryst. Growth Des. 2013, 13, 66
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        27
        Solvent Influence on Sizes of Channels in Three New Co(II) Complexes, Exhibiting an Active Replaceable Coordinated Site
        Huang, Wen-Huan; Yang, Guo-Ping; Chen, Jun; Chen, Xin; Zhang, Cui-Ping; Wang, Yao-Yu; Shi, Qi-Zhen
        Crystal Growth & Design (2013), 13 (1), 66-73CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        Three new 2D complexes were constructed by reaction of Co(NO3)2·6H2O with 4,4'-((5-carboxy-1,3-phenylene)bis(oxy))dibenzoic acid (H3cpbda) in three different solvents (N,N'-dimethylformamide (DMF), N,N'-dimethylacetamide (DMA), and N-methylpyrrolidinone (DMP)), formulated as {[Co1.5(cpbda)(DMF)(H2O)3]·(DMF)}n (1), {[Co1.5(cpbda)(DMA)(H2O)3]·(DMA)}n (2), and {[Co1.5(cpbda)(DMP)(H2O)3]·(DMP)}n (3). Complexes were characterized by x-ray single-crystal diffraction, elemental anal. (EA), powder x-ray diffraction (PXRD), IR spectra (IR), and TGA. The solvents (DMF, DMA, and DMP) were incorporated in the final supramol. structures, resp., giving rise to three similar 2D frameworks. However, the special active replaceable coordination sites in the 1D channel were also discovered. The synthesis procedure was sensitive to small mol. carbonyl solvents (DMF, DMA, and DMP), but the hydroxy (methanol and alc.) was not identified. The different coordinated and latticed solvent mols. in 1-3 propped up the varisized pore structures. By comparing the sizes of the 1D parallelogram channel in complexes 1-3, the sizes of the channels (76.84 Å2 of 3 > 74.37 Å2 of 2 > 72.76 Å2 of 1) are induced by the sizes of the solvent mols. (DMP > DMA > DMF), and good chem. stability of 1-3 was obsd. Magnetic susceptibility measurements indicated that complexes 1-3 exhibited antiferromagnetic coupling between adjacent Co(II) ions.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC38Xhs1Ons7rE&md5=41bec3582cb737ed29372c0e4d9b2069
